Reviews.Title: Quality mount -- not cheap but low-cost (by design).  Like it.
Reviews.Author: Young "GoRedSox"
Reviews.Content: I was skeptical of this mount.  Why should this be so cheap compared to other mounting kits?  I ordered one (due to the price), and prepared to return it if I did not think the mount could handle the weight of the 52" LCD TV (Samsung).Once I got it, I understood the cost.  Good low-cost design and built with solid heavy duty steel.- Two horizontal bars are load-bearing, and for proper VESA spacing, they have to be parallel and relative distance must be in the right tolerances.  These are made of solid steel.- Two vertical bars (in the wall mount) are flimsey, and that's ok.  it should be solid enough make a rectangle box w/ square angles.  That's it.- Two vertical mounting (to the TV) brackets are of heavy duty metal.  Making this in to two parts (not one), reduction of material, but also allows free horizontal adjustment on the TV mount.- By doing the above, the kit is small, uses less metal (and reduce shipping and material waste).Positives---------1. Good solid and heavy duty construction.2. Good value (low-cost).  Paid less than $ 25 including shipping.3. Easy install.  Took 15 min to figure out the instruction (which is not totally clear), and 10~15 min to install and ready to watch.4. built-in level worked well during marking of mouting holes on the wall --I tested w/ my own, and was consistent.5. Once the mounted on the wall, and bracket on TV, you could adjust horizontal TV placement on the mount, just by sliding few inches left or right, post install.  I expect this to be safe and true if the wall mount is directly screwed into the wall studs.  I do not expect dry-wall install without the use of the studs to handle such adjustment.6. The brackets on TV could also be used to adjust vertical TV placement by a few inches up and down.  But for this one, you'll need to lift TV off the bracket and adjust and pull back :-).7. There is a reasonable space (I would say, just right) from the wall to the TV to get cables/connectors through WITHOUT using any expensive 90 degree connectors.  Plenty of space between two horizontal bars to put extra power outlet and data HDMI cable outlet to hide all the cables.8. This supports tilt up/down, and works well. Amazon product description does not make it clear.Negatives---------1. Just one.  Clearer instruction so that I do not need to spend 15 min figuring things out.  One could learn a lot form IKEA :-).2. Packing/Packaging -- Not necessarily Cheetah Mount issue -- mine came w/o missing parts, although I noticed torn cardboard box edges and some parts COULD have been lost during shipping.  Either double box, or have Cheetah use heavier box stock.Helpful Hints & Comments-------------------------1. DO NOT forget to tighten the screws (2) on the bottom horizontal bars AFTER TV is placed on the wall mount -- especially if you are in CA w/ quake.  This is what prevents TV falling off the mount accidentally.  But do not over-tighten (you are NOT securing from left-to-right movement).2. Very happy w/ my purchase.  Will get one more for my other TV.

Reviews.Title: The more expensive wall mounts are overkill!
Reviews.Author: Chaz D
Reviews.Content: I rarely write reviews, but I have been installing HDTVs for over 5 years and I am constantly getting questions from people asking which wall mount they should buy.  Without exception, I refer them to Amazon and Cheetah Mounts.  I've used over a dozen of these mounts for installations, and other than the built-in level being NOT trustworthy, this is a great mount and should work for just about any TV in the 32-65" range. I have used this to mount anything from lighter LCD/LED displays to large heavier plasma TV's and it supports all of them just fine.  I have also used other expensive wall mounts in the past and so I can provide a comparative review.A lot of the reviews say the Cheetah mount looks cheap or flimsy.  In comparison to the more expensive mounts, I would agree with that observation.  However, when you understand the physics of what the wall mount is actually doing, you'll realize that a bulkier mount really isn't giving you much additional support in a fixed or tilt mount application.  That's because contrary to popular opinion, the wall mount isn't really carrying the entire weight of your TV - in fact, with the exception of articulating arm mounts, it's actually not even carrying a majority of it.  When the back bracket is installed across two studs (which is absolutely the way it should be done) and the bolts are firmly attached, the bracket, wallboard, and studs become tied together as one cohesive unit.  This allows maximum load transfer between the wall mount and the studs, which leaves the studs bearing most of the weight.  This concept applies the same whether you use a Cheetah mount or a more expensive mount.I am not saying that the more expensive mounts that use thicker gauge steel aren't stronger than the Cheetah Mount.  I would definitely wager that in a side-by-side test with increasing weights, the Cheetah Mount would probably fail before any of the other mounts I have worked with just based on the gauge of steel differences.  But, we're not talking about hanging your Ford Focus on the wall...we're talking about hanging a flat-panel TV and at the end of the day, the mount either holds your TV on the wall or it doesn't.  And, the Cheetah Mount does a fine job doing that.  This particular Cheetah mount is rated for 32"-65" TV's up to 165 lbs, and I cannot attest to the validity of that because you'll be hard-pressed to find any flat-panel display that comes even close to 165 lbs.  The heaviest TV I have ever mounted in the 32" - 65" range is a 65" Panasonic plasma that weighed 100 lbs, and that is considered to be one of the heaviest TV's out there.  This mount handled that TV perfectly fine.A few pieces of advice regarding working with the Cheetah Mount:1) As mentioned, do not trust the level that is built into the bracket - I have had some that were OK and some that were way off.  The separate 6-inch level that is included is sufficient, but if you have a 2-ft or 4-ft level, you'll be most assured of being level.2) If you don't have a stud finder, invest in one (you can use the money you saved buying this bracket vs. a more expensive one).  If you have a stud finder, make sure the batteries are good.  The bolts used to attach the bracket to the wall are large, so you want to hit close to the center of the stud to get maximum hold.3) Connect the cables to the TV before hanging it.  You may have to have a 3rd person connect the cables just as you are raising the TV.  Once the TV is on the bracket, it will sit so close to the wall that it is almost impossible to maneuver cables around.Long story short, if you're skeptical trusting your $1,000+ investment to a $25 bracket, don't be. This thing will work just fine, and you'll be patting yourself on the back that you spent so much less on your wall mount than your friends!

Reviews.Title: Can't beat it for the price! Cheetah APTMM2B
Reviews.Author: A. Thomas
Reviews.Content: Just installed a 42" Plasma in our bedroom, and here's my take:This is actually a surprisingly high-quality, sturdy mount. When I took it out of the box, I was pleasantly surprised.Be forewarned that the directions that come with this kit are mediocre at best. The pictures are vague, and only after wrangling with this pile of metal did I figure out how this thing is supposed to be assembled and installed. Please note that the mollies included in this kit are for MASONRY, not drywall. Probably obvious to most, but again the anemic instructions may lead you down a path of destruction. I may or may not have been led down said path... :-)So if you're using this in your home, here's what you need to do: 1. Assemble the rack on the floor/table/bed/whatever, and make sure it is square. 2. Find the wall studs, and mark them lightly with a pencil. 3. Hold the mount up on the wall where you want it, and the make sure the holes (not the "obvious" 4 holes) align with the stud marks. Adjust as necessary. 3. Level the mount horizontally, and drill pilot holes into the studs (make sure you are on-center!) and drill THROUGH the appropriate holes on the mount. 4. Use the included lag bolts to affix the assembled rack to the wall with an impact driver. 5. Attach the vertical bars to the TV, and then hook them on the installed rack. 6. Slide the mounted TV left/right, and tighten the clamps once the preferred angle is achieved. 7. Carefully screw the lower set screws into place (which hold the TV in place in the event that it gets bumped).I was just at <a commercial retailer> recently, and they have the EXACT same mount, under a different brand name, for $140.00. Had I purchased their product, I'm sure this review would be a tad more negatively biased.The bottom line: It works, it's sturdy, it's flexible. The instructions are lacking, which leads to frustration, but your average DYI person can pretty easily figure this out.Would I buy it again? Yes. In fact, I AM going to be buying another one real soon for the basement setup.

Reviews.Title: Had to lower my score because of manufacturing changes
Reviews.Author: Rick
Reviews.Content: I have been using Cheetah mounts for several years now.  They used to be a 5 star product, but I'm re-reviewing this product and lowering it to 1 star after they have made several changes to the product in an obvious attempt to cut manufacturing and shipping costs.  After opening the package to hang my latest television, I discovered that the top and bottom rails are no longer 1 solid piece of steel.  They are now two pieces that need to be bolted together in the center by 12 screws, just so they can make the box smaller.  The steel itself is much thinner now and instead of a powder coat finish, they are using cheap spray paint.  There used to be a bubble level attached to the top bracket, in addition to a small torpedo level in the box.  The mounted bubble level is now gone, and the torpedo level has been replaced with a cheaper one too.  You used to be able to adjust the tilt of the mount using thumb levers.  Those thumb levers are now gone, and have been replaced with philips screws, so now you need to try to hold a screwdriver in the 3" gap between the wall and the television.  Believe it or not, they even cut back on the lag bolts used to secure the mount to the wall.  Now, instead of 4 large lag bolts, they now give you 2 large and 2 small.  I used to be able to assemble one of these in 5 minutes; this one took 30.What's worse is they replaced the original Cheetah mount with this piece of crap, so they could keep all the 5-star reviews they had received on the previous bracket!  What they should have done is listed it as a new product, as they have completely changed every aspect of the product and certainly the quality.  Very deceptive practice!  I will certainly never purchase another bracket by this manufacturer.  They should be ashamed of themselves.

Reviews.Title: Don't buy this!  You'll never level your TV!
Reviews.Author: Jammies
Reviews.Content: You'll notice the majority of the positive reviews about this product are from a few years ago.  Apparently since then, they've changed the design such that the supporting main piece comes disassembled and in four pieces.  I don't know if it's just incredibly difficult to assemble this properly, or if it's now just a bad design, but the actual mount frame IS NOT LEVEL.  As another reviewer mentioned, it's sort of like a bow-tie once assembled.  However, this is not noticeable to the naked eye.  You'll think you mounted this thing level until you go to set your TV upon it, and then you'll realize in frustration just how crooked it is.Like many other mounts, this thing goes into the wall studs with huge bolts, so there's very little room to make any corrections to the out-of-level condition.  Thus, you're left with moving it a few inches up or down on the wall and starting over.  I tried hanging this thing twice, and both times it was not level.  It wasn't until after the second try that I realized the problem is the mount itself and not my leveling skill.  Not to mention the level that comes with this thing reads differently if you have it upside down (yes, you read that right, there is a proper orientation on the level - apparently the top of it isn't as straight as the magnetic bottom side).Even though I didn't get this far, I noticed the tilt functionality has to be set with the TV off of the wall.  What's worse, both sides move independently of each other, so you'd better hope you get them lined up perfectly with each other before putting your TV up.  I would imagine this could take a bit of trial and error to get right.My final complaint is really more of an annoyance that was fairly easy for me to overcome but may pose problems for others.  The "safety" screws on the rails on the back of the TV that you screw in from the bottom once its hung are difficult to reach.  I used a very long screwdriver and a flashlight, but given how close to the wall the TV is, it was a tight fit, and there's no way you could get in the handle of the screwdriver or your hands between the TV and the wall.  So, if you're going to use this and actually care about properly securing it, you will need a very long phillips screwdriver to do so.  How long depends upon the size of your TV.  I used one that was about a foot long to reach the screws behind my 42" TV.Overall, I would recommend folks stay away from this mount.  All of the glowing reviews for it were obviously for an earlier, different one-piece design.

Reviews.Title: CHECK THE DATES ON THE AMAZON REVIEWS
Reviews.Author: The Squirrel
Reviews.Content: As others have noted, the 5 star reviews written on AMZ were for a prior revision of this product - not the one shown here.  The current product for sale is junk.  Cheetah advertises this new unit as "improved" and "using less metal".  Read that as "cost-cutting" that doomed one of the best cost-quality ratio TV mounts.The new unit flimsy, uneven, and the included hardware is so bad the nuts will strip the screws on a medium torque setting.  Beware, they even cut costs with the lag screws.I fell for the "overall 4-5 star" rating game here on Amazon.  Cheetah is advertising the current (terrible) revision with the older (quality) units' ratings.  I came back and checked the review dates & now I see what they did.  Caveat emptor.

Reviews.Title: Waste of time and poorly made.
Reviews.Author: lOVEMEASALE_PowerInFashion
Reviews.Content: The screws and the holes did not match. Poorly made.  Honestly speaking I feel this product should be removed from amazon. It's not worth to be sold.

Reviews.Title: Great TV Mount
Reviews.Author: Ethan John
Reviews.Content: The Cheetah mount is an incredible value. The mount is amazingly sturdy and very well built. It took me about 30 minutes to assemble the parts out of the box. Then another hour to mount the TV to the brick above our fireplace. I used 4 Quicktap blue masonry anchors to attach the mount to the wall, and it is so secure I could probably hang from the TV itself.I was also pleased to find that the mount included all of the hardware (bolts, washers, spacers) that you would need to mount almost any VESA compatible flat panel. Our TV is a 52 inch Samsung (750 series) and the bolts I needed were included.Overall, a great buy.

Reviews.Title: Bullit Proof
Reviews.Author: Michael C. Mclean "First Fist"
Reviews.Content: I love my new home theater system.In fact, I love it so much that I tend to watch it a bit too much.The wife and I got in a heated debate about my new television use.  One thing led to another, and she tried to rip my 50" Samsung clean off the wall.Thanks to this mount the TV is still on the wall, and working well.Mount > Angry wife.

Reviews.Title: Mount is fine, once you have all the pieces
Reviews.Author: R. Nelson
Reviews.Content: I ordered this mount after doing all kinds of research on mounts out there for my new Toshiba 37" - the reviews were good, and the price even better.  And, as you know by now, one could easily pay $300 for a tilt mount if they didn't know any better and listened to the folks at best buy.Missing Part:I ordered on a Friday, and it arrived the following Thursday.  The box was tattered and looked like it had been through a war.  It was obviously a returned item, as the contents (hardware, etc) was not organized in any way.  Also, there was a major piece missing from the kit that would keep me from being able to mount the TV over the weekend.  very disappointing.  Now, i don't mind getting someone's returned item, as long as all the parts are there.  It drives me crazy to know that Cheetah resold this mount without first checking to make sure everything was there.  On Friday evening, i submitted a 'problem' through amazon to the seller - i was sure this was going to go unresolved and i would have to find another solution.  On Saturday, low and behold, i received a phone call from a rep at Cheetah who said he would send out the part, 2-day air, first thing Monday morning.Lost, i'm sure:On Thursday, i call the Cheetah rep back and tell him that I haven't rec'd the part yet.  he tells me that UPS lost it in the shipping and he just sent another one.  You know what, just tell the truth - you forgot to send it Monday. Just don't lie - it looks awful.  Now, i should get it Monday and another weekend is lost.Wrong part:Monday comes and the package arrives FedEx.  Wrong part!  I had made it crystal clear which part was missing and he seemed to know exactly which one it was.  I called him up and he blamed his warehouse people and said that he would go to the warehouse himself and watch the staff member place the correct part in the bag and slap the mailing sticker on there.  oy - this is getting ridiculous.Got it:The correct part came on Wednesday and i'm good to go.  I installed it on Sunday and it went up without any problems and I'm happy.  the mount is sturdy, adjusts horizontally very easily, and was simple to install. The built in level is wrong, so use your own.I am happy with the end result at the price i paid.  The effort it took me to get the mount and all it's pieces was insane, but i must say that the people at Cheetah mounts were nothing but nice and responsive.

Reviews.Title: I was skeptical...
Reviews.Author: R. Maggi
Reviews.Content: I took a chance, against my better judgment. I asked myself how can a $25 mount compare to a $300 mount? I have 2 girls and I would totally shoot myself if my 52" Sony Bravia (W series) ever fell on one of them. Well, I got this mount and I was already impressed. It is made of this extremely dense, slightly bumpy, but smooth to the touch metal. I mounted the first part to the wall and had my dad, who has owned his own construction company, to test it out. He approved by hanging his 180 lb body from it.I did have to take a trip to Lowes because the screws to the TV were too long (20 thread). I bought 16 thread and added 2 lock washers, per screw, that already came with the mount. I also spent $30 on a good stud center finder because I wasn't going to mess around.I feel very confident with this mount and I am very happy to have saved a bunch of money. If you buy this mount, just take your time, watch a few you tube videos about hanging a TV, and use common sense.

Reviews.Title: Cheetah Mounts APTMM2B Flat Screen TV Wall Mount Bracket for 32-65-Inch Plasma LED LCD TV
Reviews.Author: Anthony Smith
Reviews.Content: I bought this wall mount and it works ok,,,, But when you tilt it out it pushes the bottom away from the lower rail so it can't be secured on the lower part of the TV bracket. I can mod the unit but most people wont be able to... I give it a C- or D+

Reviews.Title: Good luck leveling mount!
Reviews.Author: Bell1
Reviews.Content: Because this mount requires you to attach two bars to create the top and two rails to create the bottom rails, it is next to impossible to make he entire top and bottom run level. Bad design! Mine also came missing screws. This mount is cheap for a reason. I never review products but felt it necessary here.

Reviews.Title: Very upset and surprised by reviews
Reviews.Author: I. Jorjadze "xesus"
Reviews.Content: This is probably the most unexpected failure in buying something from Amazon. Reviews seem to be amazing but here is my experience.First of all, i have installed another TV wall mount (twice more expensive) and that one was very easy, sturdy, and had perfectly matched parameters.Regarding this one:- Instructions are ok but not as detailed as they should be- Some extra pieces in the package which were not described in instructions at all (confusing)- TWO VERTICAL RODS DO NOT MATCH EACH OTHER IN SIZE AND IN HOLE LOCATIONS - no way usable, i guess i was not lucky and got defective product.- I wish it hadn't tilting function at all. When you tilt it if the TV is heavy it starts pulling the top horizontal piece putting all the pressure on the top screws- Instead of smart top like construction on the bottom there are screws that you need to screw in after the TV is mounted - i found extremely hard.I wasted my Sunday evening, ruined the wall, thanks to Amazon return/refund was easy and fast.I do not recommend buying this product but the price is unbeatable and i'm sure most of the readers will just disregard my BAD experience, that's what i would do :) Good luck!

Reviews.Title: Junk
Reviews.Author: Nick G "Nick"
Reviews.Content: This mount is junk. The mount didn't line up properly then it's pointless to have to drill 4 holes in a wall just to hang a tv. The screws that came with it to attach the tv to the mount didn't even fit. I have hung tv's before and this one was by far the most difficult. I tried to save a buck by getting this cheap mount and ended up waiting my time., thanks for Amazons easy return policy I sent it back then went to the store and bought a different one.

Reviews.Title: terrible
Reviews.Author: Rose Braunstein
Reviews.Content: after 4 hours and three people two trips to home depot to get parts that were left out of the package the television is still not mounted on the wall.  The bracket came in many pieces without the screws it was supposed to have and the HDMI cable was broken.  I bought this because of all the good reviews-sadly it sucks.

Reviews.Title: labor intensive
Reviews.Author: Pro Installer
Reviews.Content: As a someone who installs TVs and home theater for a living, I will never buy this bracket again for one reason: the "green design" also requires the user to assemble the wall plate out of six pieces using eight screws and nuts, and no real instructions provided either. Ollo mounts is able to provide a green design that requires less work, but their selection seems to be shrinking on Amazon.  I do however like the tilt mechanism of this bracket which saves it from a one star rating.

Reviews.Title: good universal design
Reviews.Author: hawkeye376
Reviews.Content: Mount was designed to fit just about any screw mount pattern imaginable.  The parts bag had everything you could think of, and sorted into labeled compartments making it easy to find the parts you needed to use for your application.  The instructions were fair, mostly pictures.  I had no trouble figuring it out.

Reviews.Title: Did not come with the seperate level, otherwise a GREAT deal!
Reviews.Author: Woody
Reviews.Content: I hate to nitpick, but if you're going to include 2!! pictures advertising a free level then you'd better deliver it along with the mount. Mine did not come with the level. The level that was built in to the mount was OFF also. I had to use a "real" level of mine from Home Depot. Everyone should just ignore the built in one.But the mount itself is not bad at all! I used the first mount to mount our 46" Samsung 650 series LCD. I'm on here buying a 2nd one now for our 50" Samsung 650 plasma because I thought this was one of the best mount deals around.There is another Cheetah APTMMB mount listed for $10 more and does not include the level. I do not know why anyone is buying that one instead of this. This one claims an added 10 pounds of support for a total possible weight of 160 pounds. That's pretty darn heavy considering our 50" plasma is only 86 pounds.I would recommend this to EVERYONE, just don't expect to get a free level and make sure to ignore the built in one. It's still worth it.

Reviews.Title: Weak design
Reviews.Author: Al
Reviews.Content: If you have not bought this bracket, look at its picture and you will know why it is cheap. Basically it is not one solid plate like most of the other brackets are. It is actually 2 separate horizontal bars joined by 2 light vertical bars. Basically the upper 2 bolts are taking the whole weight of the TV as the connection between the upper and lower bracket is hinged. On the other brackets, a solid plate share the weight of the TV between all 4 bolts.You want to make sure that your upper 2 bolts are put right, and 100% right.

Reviews.Title: Great and Sturdy. All you need!
Reviews.Author: B. Burke
Reviews.Content: Like others, I wasn't sure the low price could get a quality stand. This is an excellent one. If you take the time to mark the wall and measure the studs how the instructions recommend, you'll be fine. This is so sturdy and well-made and will last forever. I am using it for a heavy 42" Panasonic Plasma. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: DO NOT buy unless you have replacement screws/anchors
Reviews.Author: Sean
Reviews.Content: The screws that were included were way too small for the anchors that I had to use replacements. Some screws were even smaller than the ones I got from a smaller and much cheaper VideoSecu model. Absolutely not worth the $. Two thumbs down.

Reviews.Title: I'm a Believer
Reviews.Author: K4tr0y
Reviews.Content: I was very skeptical about this mount for the price point and the few parts it had. I received the item fast and unpacked it and when I compared it to mounts I had in the past, it was a fraction of the weight and very simple. Just a couple pieces that directly hook to the TV, and a few more for the mounting bracket. The TV I was mounting was a 52" Sony Aquos, so a 55" would have fit beautifully on this mount.I mounted it over the fireplace, which had an odd stud spacing, but it didn't matter with this mount as there are plenty of holes to choose from. Located the studs, centered the location, laser leveled the hole location, drilled the pilot holes, put up the mount and ratcheted in 6 lag bolts, another final leveling, and I was good to go. I was able to hang off the mount without the slightest movement from the mount...nice and solid. We put the TV up on the mount, secured it down, and voila...we were done.One thing I would have done differently is to make sure all my cables were in place before placing it up on the mount. Trying to add them once the TV was up was difficult to do.Pros: Cheap, light-weight, low foot print, sturdy, easy to install with one person (two needed for lifting TV).Cons: Cable routing is very tight and hard to adjust once in place (but all wall mounts have this issue due to the design and low foot print feature), cheap level in mount which broke off so just use your own. All in all, nothing really to complain about.I ended up buying another Cheetah mount for a smaller TV, and it was just as easy and pleasant to work with.

Reviews.Title: Not for 32" TVs
Reviews.Author: armymiz "scmiz"
Reviews.Content: Though the description says it works for 32" TVs the bracket visibly protrudes beyond all sides of the television. In addition, as other reviews have stated, washers were missing, none of the screws would fit my TV, and the wall mount is four pieces you assemble and not a solid plate. I am returning it.

Reviews.Title: Holds my 60" LG 3D plasma on the wall
Reviews.Author: DixitS
Reviews.Content: Its your average wall mount, very slim.  Works well.  Cheap (cost, not quality) which is always a plus.One small issue which cost it 1start for me.  When you put any TV I say larger than a 42" and you intend on angling it (using the upto 15degree adjustment), first realize that 15degrees is not really 15degrees, that only apples to say a 32".  Once you get a larger TV the bottom of the TV will hit the wall before you even get to say 10degrees.  That really isnt a huge issue to me, but the bigger issueis once you get that angle you want, lets say you max it out in my case on my 60", its barely 5degrees angle, you have absolutely zero ability to access the screw on the bottom side of the mount where you must screw it down to keep the TV from being lifted off the mount.So you thinking let me screw that bottom one first before angling it, well if you tighten the bottom one you cannot angle it anymore because the screw keeps it from allowing the TV to get angled because the angle itself requires more length between the bottom of the bracket mount and the top of the hook part.  So you have to losen the bottom screw at least 5turns then angle it.  Then once you angle it, good luck tigtening down the hand screw to keep the TV from angling more or being pushed back.Thats the biggest issue with these slim mounts, there is zero zoom to put even a screw driver in once its on the wall to make adjustments or tighten a screw down.

Reviews.Title: Jay
Reviews.Author: A. Jay Hunter "Nerd"
Reviews.Content: Mount was shipped by Fedex and arrived 3 days earlier than I expected.  The box was thinner than I expected but that was ok.After reading all the hassles some people had with missing screws, levels missing, etc... I was pleasantly surprised to find everything there.  The level was included and shrink wrapped.  There was an unopened bag with all sorts of bolts, screws, drywall sinks, etc... and instructions.  The only thing that I guess was missing was a wall template, but you really don't need it.Assembly.The wall bracket isn't the one piece unit that's in the $30 version.  And the reason the box is slim is because you have to assemble the bracket.  No big deal, 4 pieces, 4 screws, and 4 minutes and I was done.  Once assembled the wall bracket is very strong and feels like one piece of metal.As I said I had a complete bag of screws, and there were screws that fit my TV in the bag.  To install the mounting to the back of the tv you place a hard rubber grommit on the top of the screw hole in your tv, place the bracket on top, and screw the bracket into the TV.  Repeat 4 times.Lastly I had to hang the mounting bracket on the wall,  Once I found the studs (easy as the electric outlet box is mounted to a stud, and then every 16" there is another stud)  I mounted my bracket on two studs 32" apart.  I did a pre drill with 1/8" drill bit (to make sure I was in a stud) and then I used the 3/16 bit to make the pilot hole.  I screwed the bracket into the wall through that first hole.  The kit included strong wood boring screws.  I then leveled the mount (I used my own level, but the included level was just as accurate), and marked where to drill my second hole.  Once the fixed to the wall, I repeated for the last two holes.  I pulled on the bracket to test it, and it wasn't going anywhere.Lastly I used a 2" hole saw to cut a hole in my wall behind the TV and down by the electrical outlet (until I can get a nice trim plate) to run the wires through the back of the wall.Had my sister in law help me mount it, and was done.Once on the wall tilting isn't that difficult loosen the bolt on both brackets and tilt.  I kept mine straight, without the tilt.All in all this was easy, worth the $22.  I don't know how a $100 bracket can hold the TV to the wall better than this one.  I was very pleased.

Reviews.Title: very cheap and different size lags
Reviews.Author: Brooke Pruitt
Reviews.Content: When I saw it I was very disappointed, first it is built very cheap, i have bought 5 or 6 flat screen mounts and everyone has a solid back, this one has 6 cheap pieces that you have to screw together, and with my fat fingers it was almost impossible, will spend the extra 30 next time and go with another brand

Reviews.Title: Fantastic product, great value
Reviews.Author: crbatt
Reviews.Content: Having recently purchased a 42" plasma TV, I was frustrated to spend $100 or more (approximately 1/5 the price of the unit itself) on a mount that needed only to tilt slightly for my installation. Certainly after seeing prices of $79-$180 in BestBuy, HHGregg and other stores, I was skeptical of this unit. I hate to admit it but I think we all sometimes have the "if it's low cost, that means it's low quality" thoughts. While this may be true for many items, I couldn't be more pleased with this mount.It comes packaged in a flimsy box, and looked like a crushed paper bag on my doorstep. But fortunately the contents were undamaged and accounted for. The hardware is well labeled and packaged. Others reviews have complained about the instructions, but I found them to be as detailed as they need be. Fortunately the product is not very complex and I guess most people can figure it out. It probably took fewer than 10 minutes to assemble the unit.Hanging the mount was easy. I didn't trust the included level but, when using my own, found it to be quite consistent. Continuous screw holes across the width of the unit make it easy to screw directly into studs. I was able to hit studs for all four screws I used, and the unit was tremendously secure. After screwing in the vertical bars to the back of the TV, you simply hang your TV on the unit as you would a picture on the wall. For safety, I suggest having someone help you with that process, though it could be done by a single person. When tightened, two screws under the mount secure the TV to be sure it does not magically fall off.In addition to tilting up and down, the nature of the mount allows for horizontal adjustment of the TV as well. The space for such adjustment of course depends on the size of the TV, but with my 42", I have approximately 6"-8" L/R from the center of the mount. This came in handy when trying to mess with cables. Additionally, the mount creates adequate space between the back of the TV and the wall to plug HDMI, RCA, etc. cords without any special adaptors.For less than $25 shipped, I am extremely happy with this mount. I truly don't have any complaints. If you need a simple tilt mount that requires only minimal time to assemble and hang, I suggest this unit.

Reviews.Title: DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT
Reviews.Author: Nick B
Reviews.Content: I purchased this product 5 months ago and had no issue with it until recently when I was watching television and it fell off the wall.  I followed the instructions to a T, and installed the mount into studs.  The TV was supposed to hold 32 to 65 inch tv's, mine is 32 inches, so at the very low end.  The metal mount itself actually buckled and bent at the bottom allowing the television to tip, then fall into the floor breaking the tv.  I later contacted the company, which responded within 5 minutes of my e-mail, and was told that even if the product was defective that in 10 years the company has never replaced a TV.  There is no such thing as a good deal, PLEASE DO NOT PURCHASE THIS PRODUCT, spend the extra money on a quality product and save your television.  Now I'm out nearly 700 dollars.

Reviews.Title: excellent quality for the price
Reviews.Author: Kindle Cooking "Send your recipes to your Kindle"
Reviews.Content: I've been installing LCDs and plasmas the last 10 years, and i've seen multitude of brackets of all qualities and prices.But i'm quite impressed with this one, as is one of the cheapest available and is a really good bracket.The bracket is solid, and easy to mount, the build in lever is a cool feature (but not very accurate BTW).Another handy feature is the tilt knobs, that allows you to tilt the bracket (or not) without any tools.The bracket is relatively flat and light compared with other products and can hold virtually any LCD / PLasma on the market.I used it with Sharp 52" LCD and works like a charm.Very good product for the price.

Reviews.Title: Do not buy
Reviews.Author: Pen Name
Reviews.Content: Horrible design. Assembly was also a mess since parts did not fit. I still have not figured out how to screw in the bottom rack to your tv. You will need a foot long screw driver if u have a 60" tv. Currently only using top rack (no side bars or bottom rack) tv still secured to wall. That's a plus.

Reviews.Title: DO NOT BUY THIS HDTV WALL MOUNT!!!
Reviews.Author: Roel Gutierrez
Reviews.Content: This wall mount was gawd awful.  The engineer who designed this thing should be ashamed.  The screws that were included did not tighten sufficiently for the frame to become sturdy.  My tv is crooked because the brackets bend in the middle causing the tv to sag.  The head of the hdmi cable broke off within one week of use.

Reviews.Title: Parts were wrong and instructions inaccurate
Reviews.Author: Christopher X. Chiou
Reviews.Content: I was shocked when I tried to install this mount and found that the instructions called for a 10mm drill bit or 3/16" drill bit.  not to mention the fact that the screws provided didn't fit the anchors provided.  Horrible product!!!

Reviews.Title: check your metal
Reviews.Author: Michael M. Rodriguez
Reviews.Content: I bought this for a 50" panasonic plasma and it seemed like a great simple no frills wall mount (which is what i needed).  However after doing the initial install, i started to have my doubts.  I like the simplicity of the parts, however, you must remember that with simple parts you are only going to get simple movement with the mount.I'm just going to list off the flaws.1) DO NOT RELY ON THE LEVEL BUILT IN THE WITH THE MOUNT. That gives you a partial level measurement and is worthless if you have an uneven bracket (see number 2)2) check your horizontal bars. These are what carry the load from the tv and bolts into the wall.  However my top horizontal bar is bowed.  I realized this after utilitzing ONLY the provided level, but my eyes were screaming "the bubble is lying!"  a friend came over to help mount the TV and the first thing he said was 'dude thats crooked'.  Not only was there a slight slant, but the right side of the mount was significiantly lower than the left side and middle.  left side and middle were the same.  i took the mount off, uninstall everything and layed the metal bracket across the floor. Sure enough, the right side has a slight bow in it.  I tried bending it back a little, but it's as good as its going to get.3) the horizontal bracket holes do not align with the vertical brackets.  This is how you attach the horizontal and vertical brackets together. There are 1 hole per piece, 2 holes for each corner that line up and you screw a screw/washer in to attach.  This would be fine if the holes align properly but they dont.  I would have just drilled the hole (which would have cut into half of the pre installed hole)  but the pre installed holes are threaded, which means the screw would have not been able to screw into anything unless i had a similar sized nut laying around (which i dont)I'm not sure where everyone is getting this 'super solid steel' cheetah mount from, because the one that got delivered to me was made of pretty flimsy metal that is bowed, with holes that dont even align up properly.  If you do decided to go with the mount, double check everything with a level,  and if you end up with uneven holes, its going to look kinda funky until you have it on the wall. just make sure its bolted in tight.I dont think my TV is going to be falling off the mount, however i would definitely NOT BUY this product again

Reviews.Title: Do Not Buy
Reviews.Author: Robertson6572
Reviews.Content: This is one of the worst mounts I have ever come accross. I ordered it due to the price and good reviews on here. However, this mount is not sturdy. My 10 year old sister can bend the frame with her left pinky finger. Wait, it comes with an hdmi cord - that sucks too. Go with Sanus - it is worth paying the extra $30-40. I set it up without using instructions - very simple.

Reviews.Title: Poor architecture - missleading description  - does NOT support all TV's claimed in the description  especially > 60"
Reviews.Author: mmehrmann
Reviews.Content: Even if it is the top selling mount for two years it does not mean it will support your TV. - I purchased a Samsung 6300 60" and the mounting bar that is suppose to hold the TV is to small. Also the screws and spacers don't fit the Samsung 6300. - You might be lucky using the mount for a smaller TV.  I am also disappointment in the architecture of the mount since it takes 6 pieces to assemble the main wall part. I just don't trust the construction and I am unsure it will hold a 60"-65" TV. I ended up returning the item.

Reviews.Title: Does not fit Samsung 60 Inch LED TV
Reviews.Author: Roger S. Battistoni
Reviews.Content: This TV mount requires you to assemble it, which in itself is not difficult but time consuming.  Most mounts that I have seen come already assembled.  Also, this would NOT work with the Samsung 60 inch LED TV because there was not enough spacers and the bolts that fit my TV were simply too long.  I was surprised that Amazon recommended this with the purchase of the TV.

Reviews.Title: Total Disaster!
Reviews.Author: Brendyl Adams
Reviews.Content: Sent us the wrong parts, had to drill holes in a duplicate piece to get it to work.  VERY difficult to put together and install.  Cheep for a reason.  Only kept it because I was too impatient to wait for a replacement.  Not worth the trouble or the hdmi cable!

Reviews.Title: Do not buy
Reviews.Author: jack
Reviews.Content: Warning! I purchased 2 of these mounts because they were cheap.  I got what I paid for.  The mount comes in 4 pieces and have to be assemblied.  They are not sturdy, but will hold the tv.  It is impossible to level with the leveler provided.  Unlike other mounts, it is hard to adjust the tilt and tighten the bottum safety screws.  The cable is great.For $5 more and purchase the Atlantic tv tilting wall mount is a much better deal.  It is a one piece frame, solid, easy to mount, level, and tilt.

Reviews.Title: it didn't fall off the wall
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I can't really say anything good about this mount except that the TV didn't fall off the wall.  This is a real pain to put together. it comes in 6 pieces for the frame that attaches to the wall. trying to access the TV to plug stuff in is awful. Trying to adjust the angle and lock it in is impossible. Spend a little more and buy one that is easier to assemble and use.

Reviews.Title: Do NOT use with 100mm small to mid size TV
Reviews.Author: NYer
Reviews.Content: The frame goes on the wall well enough, but you have to make sure that it is well squared. Why wouldn't it be? Because you have to assemble the wall bracket, and part of the assembly involves attaching the top and bottom (horizontal) bar, to the left and right (vertical) bars. Yes, the manufacturer saves on shipping, but the result of the assembly is that it doesn't work well with a 100mm hole pattern on your small to mid size TV. Why?A) The top bracket comes in two pieces, left and right, that must be bolted together. (Ditto for the bottom bracket). When the top bracket is bolted together, it is solid. However, the overlapping piece of metal that bolts and holds each side together, has a different dimension than each side, and is in the center of the resulting/combined bar. That overlapping piece of metal in the center of the two bars, interferes with the two vertical hooks/brackets to be attached to your 100mm TV holes. Your expensive TV will wiggle; perhaps it won't fall off, but it will not rest solidly. If the holes are further apart, the hooks will be wider apart. But with a 100mm configuration, the hooks are too close together and can't sit flush in the center because of that overlapping piece of metal holding the two sides together. One hook will be a notch higher than the other, thereby making your TV un-level. Of course, you can slide your TV to either side of the overlapping bracket, but then the frame will not be centered with your TV and would not be hidden behind. The worst configuration is on a sub 40" TV with a 100mm hole setup, which is what I have.B) The frame of the bracket needs to be perfectly rectangular, but it likely won't be. This is because the top and bottom brackets are held together by two thinner rods running vertically on the left and right. This makes a difference because you will need the bottom bracket to be aligned perfectly with the top bracket, and those two thin rods don't easily keep 90 degree angles. This makes a difference, especially on a smaller 100mm hole setup, because you will want to use the bottom bracket to adjust the level of the TV by loosening/tightening the screws on the bottom of the vertical brackets. Good luck, because the bottom bracket may be too high to use as leverage if the bracket isn't a perfect rectangle.In short, the bracket may be fine for a larger hole configuration, but AVOID THIS BRACKET if your small to mid size TV uses a 100mm pattern. The worst part is that you can't visualize what I'm describing until you try to hang a small to mid size TV with 100mm holes. I guess its possible that someone out there had a great experience with a similar configuration, but I can't imagine how.... and I'm not going to touch the fact that the holes in the mounting arms are too large for the head of the bolts to attach your TV. You will need additional washers. Be prepared.

Reviews.Title: You get what you pay for.... CHEAP, FLIMSY
Reviews.Author: JC
Reviews.Content: Works fine but a pain to put together, very flimsy, I'd recommend buying something more substantial, also very difficult to adjust

Reviews.Title: bad mount to install with no adjustment to make it 100% level
Reviews.Author: james soohoo
Reviews.Content: the two  pieces  on top bracket and bottom bracket to join and make the bracket straight line for mounting was not 100% straight. It made it very hard to level perfectly. It should have been a solid bracket, top and bottomI will not buy this type of mount again.

Reviews.Title: Very low quality screws, incorrect tolerances
Reviews.Author: Samuel D Black
Reviews.Content: Mini carriage bolts that connect the two halves of the top and bottom support bars are very soft, stripped when I gave them any torque at all.  The vertical bars that connect the two horizontal bars were malformed and didn't fit in without some bending.  After I was finished I decided that I wasn't comfortable hanging a very expensive TV on this thing, so I went to Costco and picked up a different mount.  The difference was night and day- stay away from this thing!

Reviews.Title: AWFUL!
Reviews.Author: Bill McGlade
Reviews.Content: This is the worst mount. the screws did not fit the tv and i had to go out to home depot to get new ones. Should have returned this junk instead

Reviews.Title: complete and total crap
Reviews.Author: chrisagnew
Reviews.Content: you cant tilt this enough to properly view the tvits isnt sturdy either, I threw it away.pay a few buck s more and get a better one

Reviews.Title: So close, but ultimately very unclear directions
Reviews.Author: K. Culp
Reviews.Content: This should have taken 10 minutes to assemble TOPS. It has to do with part "P" - assembly of the basic frame. These instructions are breezed over and besides it is simply a matter of building this right - the holes are difficult to  match. THEY KNOW THIS. It seems like this was well-documented in other reviews. They simply won't fix it so I don't know why I even write this.

Reviews.Title: Amazing price
Reviews.Author: Sal Incremona
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my 65in Samsung TV, took minutes to put together and about 15 minutes to get it on the wall, Awesome price, highly recommend!!

Reviews.Title: What a NIGHTMARE
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey S. Binford
Reviews.Content: Even though this product was really cheap in price, the reviews were pretty solid.  So I bought it thinking it would be a good budget solution.  The install instructions were the worst I have ever seen in my entire life.  There were extra parts not even listed in the manual, the holes were drilled in the wrong spot, the washers were too small... The bracket itself wasn't strait or square, so even though I mounted the bracket level on the wall, when I hung the TV it was tilted to the side.  I had to remove the TV and tweek the bracket to unlevel to make the TV hang level.  All told this was a horrible purchase and an even more horrible install experience.  This is what I get for buying cheap I guess.  Pay the extra 15 or 20 bucks and get something from a decent brand.

Reviews.Title: Good option, but I'd go for the solid plate mount next time
Reviews.Author: J. Dayton
Reviews.Content: I have two cheetah mounts in my house, and you can't beat the price on them.  They're both very good products and easy to put together/mount.  That said, the slightly more expensive mount is a one piece mount; this one is four pieces that you screw together.  It is still plenty solid and I haven't had any issues, but for the extra four dollars or so go with the one piece mount.Either way, go with Cheetah mounts!  Well worth the savings.

Reviews.Title: AWESOME for the $$$
Reviews.Author: VS F2F DRUGS EVERY WEB CDCVXHXGRHCBF XXX  HEH...
Reviews.Content: Why spend $80-$100 at your local store? I mounted a new Sony 40" LCD on it..and well..for the money you couldn't ask for better. Installed my TV in about 30 minutes with this in my bedroom. TWO THUMBS UP!

Reviews.Title: Can't beat the price, but awkward installation
Reviews.Author: Ryan
Reviews.Content: PROs+ Sturdy steel construction+ Ability to tilt TV+ Can accommodate almost any bracket holes, even non-standard ones (like my discontinued Olevia 232)CONs- Pre-drilled holes don't match to the standard 16" stud distance (even the manual states that most homes have studs every 16 inches).  I had to use the pre-drilled holes on the left side, then the "wide" holes for the right side.- The included "spacers" are as long as the screws themselves, so they're worthless.- You have to adjust the tilt before you hang your TV.  First, how are you supposed to know how much to tilt it before you hang it?  Second, how are you supposed to make sure the tilt on the left side matches the tilt on the right side, unless you hang it?  You can't reach the tilt controls after it is hung, so it is a frustrating process of putting the TV on the wall, then off the wall to adjust, then on the wall again until you get the tilt right.- One of my tilt knobs were broken, so I had to secure it with a standard screw and nut.

Reviews.Title: Bait and switch
Reviews.Author: Slats&Pleats
Reviews.Content: I was impressed by the reviews of this product so I ordered for my brand new 60" Vizio. Description claims it can support up to a 165 lb tv but it couldn't even handle my 70 pounder. I even tried it on my older 50" plasma and it comes up short. Turns out all the better reviews were for a older version of this mount using heavier gauge steel. Very disappointed and sending back for a refund.

Reviews.Title: H O R R I B L E ! ! ! Stay away from these
Reviews.Author: Henry
Reviews.Content: Very cheap parts....over 10 different parts to put together. I bought 2 and both came with the 2 of the same parts and had to "re-engineer" to put them together.

Reviews.Title: Do not buy for larger TV
Reviews.Author: michael
Reviews.Content: I bought this product after going through all the reviews saying it was the same quality as the more expensive mounts. I read carefully and was concerned about this mount being able to hold my 50' plasma that's a few years old so its a little heavier (95 lbs). The mount states that it will hold up to 165lbs. After installing the mount and adding the TV, i took a look at the mount and it was literally being bent in half away from the wall because of the weight. This TV is almost 70 lbs less that the stated max weight but this mount looked like it was bending under the pressure. I immediately took it down and headed down to BestBuy to purchase a better mount. It may be ok for smalled TV's but i wouldn't mount anything larger than a 32' on this.

Reviews.Title: Thin to the extreme...
Reviews.Author: J. L. Wood "Media Engineer"
Reviews.Content: I am a CE professional having worked in consumer electronics for 30 years. In particular televisions and home theater. This is one miserably designed thin mount.1. It is unnecessarily thin.2. Cheesy material3. Darn near impossible to secure television unless you have an extra long Philips screwdriver that is also very thin.4. TV is so close to the wall the stand transfers heat and can cause paint/drywall damage.- When I pulled this down after two months to paint the room, the stand had "melded" to the wall which when removed, pulled off the paint and top paper of the drywall. Basically the wall area needed complete resurfacing.When I re-installed it, I put furring strips to space it out and spacers to push the TV out a bit, it is still impossible to secure the two screws on the hangers.I don't know what Cheetah was thinking..47" LG LEDNote" If you buy this and your flatscreen has a plug pack on the back, you may need to buy right angle HDMI adapters. Same goes for antenna coax or any audio cables.Like I said, this brings the TV so close to the wall it is ridiculous..

Reviews.Title: junk!!
Reviews.Author: telling the truth
Reviews.Content: This is junk. It's made from cheap thin metal and when you get it put together you can hardly reach behind it to set the screws so your t.v. doesn't fall off it.

Reviews.Title: Not worth the money!There are better mounts for the same price.
Reviews.Author: D. Doornek
Reviews.Content: First,the main pictures are inaccurate.There are 6 metal pieces that have to be screwed and bolted together to form the rectangular piece that mounts to the wall.You need a small metric or adjustable wrench to fully tighten the very small nuts.The picture that is included in the instructions on how the vertical pieces of the rectangle fit in place are very hard to make out.If you do it wrong they won't lay flat and you'll have to take them apart again.Finally, I wouldn't trust this thing to hold a large 65" plasma.I've put together 5 different types of mounts such as this and all the others(including an earlier Cheetah version)were much more well built.

Reviews.Title: Almost works
Reviews.Author: Kenneth horton
Reviews.Content: wall mount is sturdy and should hold a ton, the small level was cute. My only problem was that the screws supplied to mount the brackets to the back of the TV do not fit.  So, i'm left with a mounting frame on the wall and the flat sceen (Emerson) still on a stand. The details should state "fits most/some" flat screens.

Reviews.Title: Simplifed to the extreme
Reviews.Author: Casuistry "Derek"
Reviews.Content: Directions are to the point and accompanied with easy to understand pictures.  All parts that are included will give you multiple options (i.e. multiple screw sizes) further cementing the fact that this is quite a universal mount depending on your tv's manufacturer.  I used it for a 32" Sony LCD Bravia.Only complaint I would have is:  The 2 "hook" latches (used to attach tv base onto the wall mount itself) are difficult to hand-work to the exact degree between both latches without a measuring device such as protractor.  This could cause one latch to be slightly uneven compared to the other, which will tilt the tv slightly, but it is quite an easy fix.

Reviews.Title: Not for my 65" Samsung
Reviews.Author: Stevie G
Reviews.Content: I was looking to get something very low-profile to mount my newly purchased Samsung 7100 65" LED.  When i first received the tiny box for this item I had doubts about if it would work with my TV.  The frame for this unit actually has to be assembled so it is very compact when shipped.  Ultimately Im sure it would have supported my 65" LED, but the distance between the wall and the back of my TV with this mount is only 1.3".  My TV has a combination of input jacks that come off the back, both sideways and some that come straight back.  The ones that come out straight back are the problem, specifically with the optical audio cable I was planning on using.  I would have had to bend the back of the cable at an undesirable angle to get it to fit.  I considered getting a 90 degree adpater, which would have allowed for the connection of the cable without having to bend it, but after considering my options decided to go with a more versatile mount that I could use, the ATDEC TH-3070-UFL Telehook, also sold on Amazon.  It has a full motion articulation and provide ample sapce between TV and wall (2" min to 25" max).  It costs severals times the price as the Cheetah Mount, but will provide the right versatility for me to connect all the cables I neeed and easy accerss to the back of the TV for future cable changes.

Reviews.Title: Stud in center of wall - no problem!
Reviews.Author: Voyager
Reviews.Content: Used this to mount a 50" plasma TV and I was very pleased with how flexible the bracket is.  I had the situation where the center of the wall fell right on a stud.  I was worried that I would end up with the TV off center.  This didn't happen since I was able to shift the mount to one side (there are several mounting holes) to line up with the studs (16" on center) but then hang the TV shifted in the other direction so it ended up centered on the wall.  The directions were well written, all the parts were neatly packed and well labeled.  The included HDMI cable was much nicer than expected.

Reviews.Title: Seemed like it was a good buy...
Reviews.Author: Nick..
Reviews.Content: Couple screwsCouple pieces of metal..Should be able to mount a TV right? Not so much with this bracket. The frame itself would not go together anything like the instructions directed. I even had to bend a few piece out of place so the holes would actually line up. Save yourself the hassle, just pay a few more dollars for something useful.

Reviews.Title: Be Careful...
Reviews.Author: Chase Webb
Reviews.Content: I would definitely not buy this mount again. In fact, I'm returning one of my two that I purchased. I originally bought two of these to hang my Samsung PN50A450, an older an very HEAVY 50" plasma, and an el cheapo 32" LCD. I started putting it all together no thanks to the largely useless instructions and realized this thing would not begin to hold my TV. Or if it would, it wouldn't for long.The wall bracket is in four separate pieces, not one solid piece. Once it was built, it just felt lightweight and flimsy. The two brackets that mount on the back of the TV were just okay, but were only meant to hang on the top rail of the wall bracket. The bottom only sat against the bottom rail and was held (I use that term loosely) with bolts that could be tightened to kind of sort of hold it in place. The whole setup felt really chintzy.Before I made a relatively permanent commitment, I went to Best Buy and price matched with Amazon a $150 Sanus wall mount. Amazon had the same exact bracket for $60. Best Buy price matched and I walked away with a very sturdy wall bracket for $60. Much sturdier, wall bracket is one solid piece, and it's currently holding my plasma to the wall.I'll keep one of these to hang my lightweight LCD in my bedroom, but I would never trust it with a larger and heavier TV.

Reviews.Title: Great Value on this inexpensive, tilting TV mount.
Reviews.Author: JK-123
Reviews.Content: First off let me say, anyone who spends $100 or more for a tv mount when this is out there as an option is crazy.  I was pleasantly suprised when this showed up at my house for only a fraction of the cost of one of the big box stores mounts.  This one was easy to assemble and install and the little level provided worked well for the job.  When you think about it, there really isn't much to a TV mount and this one gets the job done with ease.  My TV went up on the wall in about 30 minutes start to finish.  Definitely glad I decided to save my money and take a chance on this mount.

Reviews.Title: It works. It is perfect. Thank you.
Reviews.Author: John "John"
Reviews.Content: Just want to say thanks for striking another blow for freedom against the Man, namely Best Buy. I thought $200 was a bit much to spend on a TV mount and, you know what, I was right!Easy to align with studs, then TV can be adjusted side to side on rails for centering where you want it. It says it can only be adjusted between flat to the wall and 45 degrees but can do in between as well.Quite happy overall.

Reviews.Title: Cheap mount with multiple flaws.  Barely worth $25 let alone the claimed $80
Reviews.Author: JR Gumby
Reviews.Content: The only real reason to get this mount is that it appears to hold a television and is cheap.  Granted, if that's what you're after it is roughly what you pay for.  Still, that's what I was after and I regret not paying another 25 dollars (or somewhat more) and getting a more quality product.Unfortunately the design is poor.  Very poor.  I am frankly startled that it has received such good reviews.When screwing the top bolts into the frame the washers were slightly too large to lie flat and ended up at a slight angle, preventing the bolts from being fully screwed in.  The frame is also somewhat flexible and there was some curve that couldn't be removed from the top of it.  It did still end up being firmly attached to the wall.The tilt function will not be held constant by tightening the suggested screw.  When even a few pounds of pressure were exerted on it it still tilted regardless of how much the screws were tightened.  In the end we had to add additional bolts and nuts to force it to hold it without tilt.Even with the supplied spacers cords which protrude from the rear are very tightly squeezed between the television and the wall.  Removing them without removing the television is difficult if not outright impossible and I'm frankly concerned about the integrity of the jacks over the long-term.  This is even without any tilt: with tilt I think the entire weight of the television would be set against the cords (and without modification I could not prevent tilt).The supplied accessories are totally worthless.  The level is at best cheaply made and gave obviously slightly-off-level reads.  The HDMI cable is the kind of thing Best Buy should have on hand to try and sell monster cables.  I had massive quantities of static, flickering pictures, and entire dropped frames and seconds of audio over it: in short it is more useful as a rope than as a cable.Overall: I would not recommend this product to anyone.  It is simply not worth $25.  It is very cheaply made and isn't even functional out of the box if you want want to have any control over the vertical angle of your set.

Reviews.Title: Highest quality, lowest price! Fit my new samsung 850 series!
Reviews.Author: J. L. Disberry
Reviews.Content: I don't normally take the time to write a review unless the product exceeded my expectations. I am thoroughly impressed here. I bought a new 50" samsung. The new 850 series at best buy. The staff told me that the sanus and others would not be compatible with this model. They directed me to samsung's $300.00 slim-line picture style hanging mount. I declined and found this gem online. Glad I did! I figured with the low price, I might as well try it out and if it didn't work out, no big deal.. maybe I could have modified it necessary. Well, I found this product to be of high quality and very simple to mount in no time.  It came with levels as well! Also included is different screws for most Plasmas. In short, don't waste your money on anything more expensive. If you have a four bolt square pattern anywhere in the back of your set, I can't imagine it not working for your tv and doubt you will be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: What can I say
Reviews.Author: Michael Smith
Reviews.Content: There really isn't much to say about this product except that it does, in fact, hold a television securely to the wall. Mine is attached to a Samsung LN52A650 52" LCD monster. The TV extends just under 7" from the wall, leaving ample space to put things on the entertainment center under it. I had no problem setting up and installing this mount. It came with all necessary hardware, minus the "free level included." That didn't bother me so much as I have my own torpedo level already, but, false advertising is still false advertising. Don't try to follow the built in lever either, it's not exactly accurate. Use your own level, follow the directions and save money by purchasing this TV mount.

Reviews.Title: Wall Mount
Reviews.Author: Mista Moody
Reviews.Content: Product was hard to install due to the quality of material. Had to make many adjustments to level TV even though wall mount came with built in level. Poor quality, would not recommend.

Reviews.Title: Great.
Reviews.Author: Amber beach
Reviews.Content: This was easy to assemble and install. It comes with instructions and if you follow them, it will be a breeze. It was a total of 9 steps, and took maybe 20-30 mins tops to install. I love that it came with a level and a LONG HDMI cord.

Reviews.Title: Just what I wanted
Reviews.Author: Frannie
Reviews.Content: I have looked all over the town where I live to get wall mounts for my TV's and they are very expensive, when I found this one the price was awesome and it went together easily and is just what we wanted for our TV!

Reviews.Title: Great ultra-low profile mount
Reviews.Author: Timothy Shuler "meterman"
Reviews.Content: Very strong mount. It is very low profile.I have a Vizio 55" LCD mounted with this. Price can't be beat. Plus you get an HDMI cable as an added bonus.With a bigger tv size, be prepared to use (or buy) a very long Phillips screwdriver. You'll need it to tighten the anti-tilt screws on the bottom. These keep the tv from being lifted off the mount by the bottom and it can be a pain if u don't have some patience. Once tightened, the tv ain't going nowhere. I'd buy it again if I needed a low-profile mount. But if I had it to do all over again, I'd probably buy the Cheetah full motion mount. Also, make sure you have help when mounting tv - because of the low profile design, you'll have to make all your connections before placing tv on the wall. You'll need one or two ppl to hold the tv while the connections are made.

Reviews.Title: Junk do not buy
Reviews.Author: Johnny-X
Reviews.Content: They can't be bothered to include decent wall anchors so just imagine what junk the rest of the mount is.

Reviews.Title: Not worth the mone
Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: I'm very dissatisfied with this product.  It's very thin cheap metal. It almost did not fit my tv. Any I only own a 60 inch. I'd be willing to bet it won't fit a 65 like it says in the spesifications. For under $40 I guess you can't expect much. I hope my brand new tv does not fall off the wall!

Reviews.Title: Not a quality TV mount.
Reviews.Author: Mark Warren
Reviews.Content: I had my contractor install this mount something he's done dozens of times. He had difficulties assembling and mounting level all due to poor construction of the mount. This is NOT a quality mount at least not anymore I'm reading that the manufacturer recently change the design and they're relaying upon the high ratings from the previous design.

Reviews.Title: Very poor design
Reviews.Author: Derrick D Horton
Reviews.Content: Please read all the newer reviews. All the older reviews are for the older models. This is not the one piece unit they used to sell. This is a four piece very flimsy model. Long story short: it flexes and you will not level your TV. Also if you are plugging anything like component cables or optical cables into the back of your tv they will be crushed against the wall no matter how you try to tilt the TV. I just threw it away.

Reviews.Title: Inexpensive for a reason
Reviews.Author: Rp1168
Reviews.Content: Flimsy. Holes didn't line up very well on brackets. Screw heads stripped easily. Wish I would have spent a little extra and got a quality mount.

Reviews.Title: Looks and feels terrible
Reviews.Author: MKG
Reviews.Content: What a horrible piece of junk... Lousy / flimsy hardware.. Looks awful .. I have a 32 inch samsung LCD and the mounting brackets do not allow a flush fit on the back of my tv, without 6 inches of bracket showing on the top. No thanks.

Reviews.Title: Don't waste your money
Reviews.Author: CHRISITNE OBANNER
Reviews.Content: It broke by the time we put the 2nd screw in. It is not sturdy spend ur money else where!!!

Reviews.Title: Missing parts and no option to contact seller
Reviews.Author: Sydney Piercey
Reviews.Content: We had to make several trips to the hardware store for little things like screws, nuts, washers, bolts... pretty much everything that should have come with the bracket but didn't.  After many frustrating trips across town we finally got the bracket assembled, but are still questioning the reliability of the bracket.  It doesn't seem sturdy AT ALL and of course now we are worried because we had to purchase parts that didn't come with it just to assemble it.I wish we had just bought one in town that had all of the parts.  It would have saved hours of trouble.

Reviews.Title: Unrealistic expectation
Reviews.Author: Andrew Goldstein
Reviews.Content: When I purchased the 50 inch Samsung tv, there was a note that those who purchased the tv also purchased this item.  The description is it suits TV's 32-70 inches.  When we hung the tv with these brackets, we noticed the advertised 15% angle was not nearly sufficient for the size tv.  I find it hard to believe someone can advertise it as suitable for a 50 inch tv.  It looks awful and now I have to return it and pay for the shipping??Very disappointed

Reviews.Title: Good for lightweight televisions
Reviews.Author: K. Goodwick
Reviews.Content: This mount started to bend with our older heavy plasma. It has many nice features, but would work best on newer, very light weight televisions.

Reviews.Title: Worst Tv Bracket Ever!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Vlad
Reviews.Content: Its the worst mount you could possible buy. The mount comes in pieces and needs to be put together. It held buy little bolts and nuts that didn't look to durable. After putting it together a insltalling it we tested to make sure it held our tv. It didnt. It bend and we had to take it all part and ship it back.

Reviews.Title: Awful
Reviews.Author: Adrienne Smidt
Reviews.Content: Extremely difficult to set up, took all day, damaged my wall & I ended up throwing it out & buying a different one at Walmart that worked perfectly & was easy to install. Don't waste your money on this awful thing.

Reviews.Title: cheating
Reviews.Author: Mohankumar Mani "Mohan"
Reviews.Content: Low quality mount. Seller is cheating by using the old review of the earlier product. Now its been changed. Image is fake. The Mount comes in 6 pieces and we need to assemble it.

Reviews.Title: DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY
Reviews.Author: J. Gallimore "2yellowmustangs"
Reviews.Content: I bought several of these to mount 40" TV's . The mounts are cheap and it takes 30 min to put it together plus the time to hang the tv. Very disappointed .

Reviews.Title: Do your homework. This mount is flawed yet works.
Reviews.Author: Gerald P. Weger
Reviews.Content: First the good news. The TV (55"LG) is up and seems like it will stay up which is the obviously the primary objective.Now for the bad. This unit (and probably any unit) consists of two main parts. The part that mounts to the wall and the part that fits on the TV. I don't know if there are any industry standards but if the spacing holes on the back of my TV were 1 mm further apart this unit would not have fit. Luckily it did. The supplied spacers and bolts made for a secure fit.This mount has a tilt feature. This is on the part that fits on the TV. There are no reference marks that allow you to measure whether each side is the same. Further each side has two mounting claws and they have to be lined up as well. It's all done by eyeball. Not exactly confidence building.The part that bolts to the wall is straight forward except that you have to assemble it and some of the hardware is hard to tighten without a socket of the right size. Or you could use the less elegant way and grab it with a vise grips.I had a wall socket to work with. Naturally the mount ended up crossing the outlet. Not the mounts fault but it would be nice if there was some provision to lower or raise the center section of the mount for clearance. If you don't have a wall socket this is not relevant.The worst feature is that the mount has two locking screws to be utilized once everything is assembled and hung. This is a safety feature but it is unusable because there is no possible way to reach those screws. You'd have to have a very long flexible screwdriver and get very lucky since you can't see those screws to tighten them if you could reach them.Since the TV depends on gravity unless you foresee the TV jumping up in the air those screws can be left un-tightened, not that you'll have a choice. Perhaps if you were using a much smaller TV you could access the screws.So, in summary, the mount did the job but I am sure a little research and a bit more money would give you a mount that was thought out a bit better. Since this was my first mounting of a large TV I didn't do the proper research but you can be sure if I ever have to do this onerous task again it won't be with this mount.

Reviews.Title: Poor construction. Poor instructions,
Reviews.Author: Glenn Z.
Reviews.Content: Instructions for assembly  were vague and incomplete. The mount is poorly constructed . While the mount on the wall is installed absolutely level, I found the tv 1/8 inch out of level in the 36 inches side to side.  The mount is economical but sometimes quality costs more.

Reviews.Title: Didn't come with all of the parts
Reviews.Author: Don Sebert
Reviews.Content: This mount is very cheap compared to the one I bought about a year ago for the exact same price.  It will do the job because I am only mounting a 42 inch TV.  I would not trust this mount for anything larger however.  As I was getting ready to put the mount up I discovered that it was missing 2 of the bolts and spacers needed for hanging it.  Didn't feel like emailing the company for 2 bolts and waiting to get them in the mail.  I went to the hardware store and bought what I needed for $6.  I just know not to buy from this company again.

Reviews.Title: mount seems not very sturdy and I can't install wires and such behind tv. I really made a mistake in purchasing this model
Reviews.Author: Vaughan
Reviews.Content: mount seems not very sturdy and I can't install wires and such behind tv. I really made a mistake in purchasing this model

Reviews.Title: Zero complaints
Reviews.Author: Tinyan Asemota
Reviews.Content: I gave this 5 stars because I can't think of one thing about this mount that I don't like.  It arrived in about 2 days, all the pieces were there as described, and my boyfriend had the TV mounted within 45 minutes (we have never mounted a TV before).  We used it to mount our 39" Insignia.  Unbeatable price, too.  Best Buy recommend a mount that was $99.99!  Quick, easy, functional, and affordable.

Reviews.Title: good quality
Reviews.Author: USNMSCRET
Reviews.Content: Worked very well with 60" PlasmaInstructions were well written and understandable, would reccomend to family and friends..very well done

Reviews.Title: the mount comes in SIX pieces and has to be assembled - not cool.
Reviews.Author: Steven Pustylnik
Reviews.Content: The main part which attaches to the wall comes in SIX pieces and has a bunch of little bolts/nuts that are a pain in the neck to unscrew/screw in. On my particular TV the brackets attached very closely together and the bolts/nuts were directly in the middle of the mount and prevented the TV from sitting securely.  I have installed over 500 TVs on walls and this is by far the worst experience with a TV mount.  Every mount of this sort is flat without any obstructions (like the bolts/nuts) which allow the TV to slide left-right but not this one!  How much did the company save on packaging by requiring me to assemble the mount???!!! The mount isn't as strong as it should be as compared to one long bar on top, and one long bar on the bottom.  It should come assembled and ready to go.

Reviews.Title: Great mount with tilt capability and 1 inch from wall
Reviews.Author: Z. Khan
Reviews.Content: Great mount that combines tilt capability with 1.3 inch from wall installation.  Assembling and installing it was a breeze with a 70 inch LCD TV.  Would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Blonde Girl Proof! ;)
Reviews.Author: Alicia Schuette "Alicat"
Reviews.Content: Love this product!Easy to assemble, and thats saying alot since I'm a very unhandly around the house girl.TV hasn't fallen; and I even bummped it a few times! Still holding strong.Very recomended!

Reviews.Title: Love the wall mount
Reviews.Author: Photo Clicker "James"
Reviews.Content: I have 2 Samsung flat panel TVs that I mounted with these wall mounts. They were very easy to assemble and mount to the wall. The level that was included came in handy. I noticed that some people complain that once the TV is mounted on the wall with this mount that it is nearly impossible to plug different devices into the TV. I found the best way to overcome this problem is to NOT tighten the bottom screws on the mount arms until everything is connected to the TV. It is easy to simply swing the bottom of the TV away from the wall to gain access to the plugs.

Reviews.Title: First time hanging a TV
Reviews.Author: Robert E Kozaczka Jr
Reviews.Content: This was my first time hanging a TV.  I read quite a few reviews before purchasing and decided it was worth trying for the price.I broke the install up over a few days based on the time I had available.  I assembled the bracket one evening, I put the brackets on the TV another evening, etc. It was probably a total of 90 minutes from opening the box to having the TV on the wall.I followed everything the directions said.  I located the studs and drilled small holes on either side to know exactly where the edges were so I could mount in the center of the stud.  I have wood behind my drywall so after drilling the test hole, I stuck a coat hanger in to verify if I was in the stud or the wall cavity.I used my own level since I already had it out.  I put the 4 included lag bolts in to the studs, double checked that it was level and I was done.  Before hanging the TV, I put as much of my weight as I could on the bracket and it didn't budge.  I was comfortable putting my TV up.The mount keeps the TV very close to the wall.  My TV (Samsung 6100 series) has a right angle power connector.  Even with this cord, it touches the wall because the TV is so close.  Also, I have 1 HDMI port that faces to the side.  That one works fine with a regular cable.  I ordered a right angle cable to hopefully utilize the rear ports.I highly recommend the mount for the price.  Just take your time installing and read all directions.

Reviews.Title: Garbage don't buy
Reviews.Author: Eduardo Weber
