Reviews.Content: Just got it today and I'm very disappointed. first of all it barely fits my 46" tv and I'm wondering if it can even support the weight of the tv. Feels like its made out of thick aluminum. I'm gonna have to call them to see if they will cover the cost if there product fails and my tv falls, if they don't I'm returning this item. I wish company's would tell you when there products are sub pair.

Reviews.Title: You better hope everything is in the box!
Reviews.Author: Kathie Conaway
Reviews.Content: I purchased this Cheetah mount before Christmas 2012 and finished my remodel a month ago.  We went to install the wall mount only to find that one of the hooks that affixes to the back of the TV (should come with 2) was missing.  I called Cheetah Mounts LLC and they said they would check the warehouse because they have updated this model twice since I purchased it, to see if they have that part available and would call me back.  They never called back (strike 1).  I then contacted Wayfair who stated that because it was past the 30 day guarantee, they could not help and told me I would have to call the manufacturer (strike 2).  I called Cheetah again and they stated that they didn't have another bracket and said they could get me a new one but I would have to pay for a whole new mount (STRIKE 3).  I received horrible customer service at both places.  Wayfair should have stood behind the product they were selling and didn't.  Cheetah should have stood behind the product they manufacture and didn't.  I WILL NEVER PURCHASE FROM EITHER COMPANY AGAIN!  If I could give negative stars, I would.  Now I have to go purchase another wall mount and can guarantee it will not be a Cheetah, nor from Wayfair.

Reviews.Title: Missing major parts. Just returned out of frustration.
Reviews.Author: MrD0nut
Reviews.Content: Just read all the 1 star ratings and you will understand why I say that. Don't buy unless you want to risk having to return. Good thing  Amazon let me return so easily. It was missing the HDMI cable. And the 2 top bracket pieces that hook to the wall. FAIL

Reviews.Title: Not without its flaws.
Reviews.Author: The_Swag_King_Kong
Reviews.Content: We'll let me first say like most, when I purchased this the included HDMI cable caught my attention. I think most would agree it's a great buy almost for that alone. The unit itself isn't bad either, if your handy enough to make necessary adjustments. This is the first mount I've purchased as I prefer my flat screen on a table. In any case, I purchased this to hang my new Samsung 43" in the bedroom. I've read many reviews on this cheetah, some so bad I'm in curious how they could have received the same product as the reviewer above or below which were mostly outstanding. I think it simply comes down to two things. How handy you are and your TV. All my nuts and bolts came with the neatly packaged bracket and subpar assembly directions. Having to put the wall mount together, as its 4 pieces is something I obviously missed when buying. I'd recommend anyone reading, go for a mount wielded as one. But.. If ur trying to save a buck and again handy, go for it. After assembly It was time to mount, which was fairly straight forward. The mount wasn't heavy and I was able to hold it with one hand while I marked my hole locations with the other. Then finally drill with no problem. Boom! Mounted. Now here comes the s*** part. The TV brackets weren't long enough for my screen. I had to file the ends so that the bolts wouldn't rub resulting in them going through crooked. Had it not been for my roommate who had an industrial strength file and the wherewithal to even think about doing so. I would have been completely SOL with already so much time invested. K so yeah, maybe it's just my TV. But many people own Samsungs I'm sorry this is a design flaw. That said, the rest was Samsungs fault. All my connections HDMI, USB ect. are on the back not the side. Making it hang with a tilt impossible as the cables wouldn't allow it. So keep that in mind if ur connections are on the ass end. Back to the bracket. The safety screws are virtually impossible to tighten once the TV is up. The low profile design is nice. And I'm sure having to do it again wouldn't take the length of the Miami / Bulls game that was on.  It's seems really sturdy bolted into my apartment stucco walls (wood studs). Again the HDMI cable/leveler were nice additions. If I ever buy another mount however, it'll be another brand. Over all I give it 3 of 5 stars. 2 for price, 1.5 for the HDMI. That's it, cause nothings perfect. If you own all the necessary tools required. And then some. (a file) Your probably the kind of girl/guy that can get this to work for you. If you have to run to Lowes and ask what's the best stud finder. Probably not.

Reviews.Title: Very Happy
Reviews.Author: R. Dixon
Reviews.Content: Great TV mount. My 60" TV is sleek and slim looking mounted so close to the wall. Instead of bulky and far off the wall like some mounts. The only problem. Plan on spending extra money for a right angled HDMI cable or adapter if your TV's input is straight out the back. If the input comes in the bottom or side you will be fine. The mount is so close to the wall that the HDMI cable end will not bend and fit in the narrow space. So order an adapter from Amazon because I paid $16 for one at Walmart.

Reviews.Title: Mounting to WALL-Cheetah Mounts APTMM2B Flush Tilt Dual Hook
Reviews.Author: Silence Dogood
Reviews.Content: Works great but mount the wall bracket on two 2x4's for the top and one for the bottom of the bracket and extend the 2x4's out past the bracket right and left to gain two more anchor points on the wall.  This way you can anchor into all three studs in the wall.  The 2x4' will also allow you room to tilt the TV down.  The HDMI cords etc stick out of the Tv, which will not allow you to tilt the TV down unless you can gain space between the wall and the TV bracket.  Attached the hooks to the TV and Lift the TV and hook to the bracket mounted on the wall and screw in bottom set screw or not either way it's hung like a picture.  Great mounting system very sturdy.  KISS Idea at its finest (Keep it simple Stupid).  Example:  mount your top and bottom 2x4's on the back of the bracket and screw bolts though the bracket holes into the 2x4's and then into the wall.  Hope this helps everyone. I took it a step further and screwed small lag bolts through the bracket holes into the 2x4 backing and then placed the entire holder on the wall, drilled Six holes 16inches on center through the 2x4's  (three holes for top and three for bottom) while holding it on the wall and then screwed 3" lag bolts through the holes I drilled in 2x4's through the wall plaster board and into the wall studs. The small level was an added gift to help level it fast.

Reviews.Title: Great for the money! BUT if cables insert in back of your TV, read on!
Reviews.Author: R. Wilson
Reviews.Content: I mounted my 42" Panasonic Plasma to the wall with this, instructions are a bit convoluted (it's actually way easier to put this together than it looks!) but I was able to mount it (even with my studs being spaced strangely) and it holds it perfectly, well almost, my particular TV's power connector I guess is kind of big and using RCA cables for my game system and a couple of HDMI cables, they were being crushed because of how low profile this is, to get around this, I had to extend the Safety Screws to prevent the bottom part from attaching, this gave the perfect amount of space for my cables BUT, if someone is underneath the TV and accidently pushed up it could fall (the purpose of the safety screws prevents this but since I use them to give space, this is my fault if something happens). Otherwise, it's perfectly secure as long as no one pushes up on it.If your cables plug into the back of the TV (and extend more than an inch or 2) you may want to keep this in mind, it's fine though for me, for the price, I'm good with it! But it it's likely someone may push up on the TV, you may want to check on other models.

Reviews.Title: Good and Sturdy but Complicated Setup...
Reviews.Author: K. W. Allen
Reviews.Content: SURE! It's a good, sturdy, well manufactured mount. After having it up, that TV ain't goin nowhere. However, if you are a first time mount buyer like I was, BE prepared for getting the mount up and ready for use. You're gonna need proper drill bits, you're gonna need either a stud finder (behind your walls) or know where the studs are. Being that is the only way to actually put it up safely, otherwise once you put the TV on it, it will just rip right out of your wall and fall on the floor. So, if this isn't your first time with mounting a TV and you know what you're doing, it's great. If you've never mounted a TV before just be ready for some handywork and possible that your mount not even able to go where you want it. Just be aware the frame has to be drilled directly to a stud in your wall.

Reviews.Title: Good sturdy mount but will require a trip to the local hardware store
Reviews.Author: Happy Couple "Happy Couple"
Reviews.Content: PROS:The mount as a whole is very sturdy and easy to install.The level is a nice plus.The HDMI cable was very nice, and with a thick nylon braided coating giving it extra protection if you are running it through the wall.The tilting function is very nice for mounting high enough to keep little hands away.CONS:Plan on a trip to the hardware store.Not enough of the correct bolts to hang on a wall.Screws to attach it to the tv are too short.Don't use for anything smaller than a 32" or the frame will extend beyond the TV.Review:Mine arrived in 1 business day (used super saver shipping) so I was very excited but was kind of whatever with it being so small. The rear mounting plate is in 2 parts and needs to be put together with 4 screws. The package has a lot of screws in it. To mount to a wall it only has 4 hex blots with plastic anchors. I was mounting on hollow drywall with metal studs (not ideal) made my trip to the hardware store and purchased 4 toggle bolts and 4 self tapping drywall/stud screws (long threads don't require an anchor) with a drywall rating of 50 lbs . Once mounted I gave it a test, I'm not a small guy by any means (ex-college offensive lineman) and was doing a dead hang on the mount without any give what So-ever. (this method of mounting is not preferred, and is not recommended by builders and your experience may vary). I then went to mount the tv with the provided 4x.07 mm screws provided, way to short I don't think the could work I any tv especially since a washer is needed to fill the whole in the mount. So made my second trip to the hardware store and purchased a 20 mm length screw with one if the oversized plastics spaced washer provided. TV is Hung and looks very nice.  The only little thing is that the mount on the walk is long and I very visible behind my 32" TV and anything from just off center you can see the wall mount.

Reviews.Title: You are paying for Cheap and that is what you are getting
Reviews.Author: Scott Beauchemin
Reviews.Content: The issue with this mount is if you have a heavy TV, the screws for the tilting part of the mount, will NOT hold the TV from tilting all the way down, regardless of how tight you screw them in.  I have a sony 52" XBR 3D TV (66 lbls), and the TV's weight pulls the tilt down.  We took it off the wall a few times and tried to tighten the screws as tight as possible, but still it does not hold.So if you don't have a heavy TV, it will probably work just fine.  But if you have a heavy TV, I would avoid this mount.Pros: Price, Comes with HDMI Cable (didn't use it so not sure the quality), comes with a level (this is a great idea) and it was easy to install

Reviews.Title: Its cheap for a reason
Reviews.Author: adam
Reviews.Content: my cheetah mount arrived missing parts.  The frame is assembled with 4 screws, and one of them had fallen out.  I tried to put it back in, but it wouldn't hold (hole was stripped out, not long enough to attach a nut to it).  The other screws in the vertical holder had also fallen out, and i was missing a nut on one of them.  I'm pretty sure my TV would have fallen off the wall had i not returned it.

Reviews.Title: Decent mount for my bedroom TV
Reviews.Author: Bob B "The Bass Man"
Reviews.Content: Looking for a budget price tilt mount?This one will do.For the price,it does the job,but the tilt adjustment is difficult to reach and tighten on a VESA 200x200 setup on my 42"Visio.I bought this mount expecting this to be a problem,and in that respect am not really let down.I needed a tilt mount at 15 degrees to make 3D more watchable from my bed.It came with all the required hardware to install it and it all went well and installed quickly.I have had and installed several different tilt mounts over the years for myself as well as others.I would suggest using a real level at least 24 inches long(not use the included ones. When you locate where your wall studs are and determine your desired placement for viewing,draw a light pencil line with a real level,then flip the level and check it for accuracy.Mark the holes for the top to pre drill 2 holes for the 2 larger lag bolts in the centers of the studs dead center on your level line on the wall.Be sure you use a bit smaller than the thickness of the lag bolts threads.Use the washers and attach the 2 top bolts.Do not overtighten the bolts,just snug enough to recheck with a level on top,then tighten so they wont move anymore.Pre drill for the smaller lower 2 bolts usiing a smaller bit again,place the smaller washers on the bolts and snug them up as well.Attach the brackets to the back of the tv(be sure the tilt adjuster screws face outward),back off on the bottom rail set screws on the wall mount attach your cables and power plug and hang your tv.Tighten the bottom rail set screws and you are done.It will stay at about 15 degrees.Changing the tilt on this model is not much of an option,so just tighten the tilt screws as much as you can and you're done.If doing this is too difficult,have someone else do it so you will be sure your tv will not detach from the wall(a bad day for sure.)Overall, as I have said...a decent mount for the price,but if your tv is over 42 lbs,choose a heavier mount.This one did what it needed to do for me at a budget price.The included 10 ft 1.4 HDMI etherenet cable works well with my Panasonic 3D Blu-ray player.

Reviews.Title: Solid, inexpensive wall mount
Reviews.Author: waetherman
Reviews.Content: I got this mount specifically because the wall I needed to install to had 24" studs, and this is one of the few mounts made to fit that wide pattern. It would also fit the standard 16" pattern as well, though if your tv is on the smaller side (37-42) you might be better off getting a smaller 16" mount because this one will be more visible behind the tv. Overall the mount works very well - the instructions are a little cryptic, perhaps because of all the various mounting options (masonry, wood, etc) but if your attaching this to standard wood studs it's as straightforward as can be; measure, pre-drill holes with a 3/16th bit, then put in the supplied wood screws. Easy, fast, and very solid. Holds my 40" 55lbs tv just perfectly. I was a little disappointed that it is that far out from the wall, since the specs say 1.6" and it's actually closer to 2.5", but it's not too much difference. I think it could be more compact if the brackets that affix to the tv were a little more svelt - they seem overbuilt for their purpose and far too thick, though that may be to accommodate larger, heavier TVs and to allow for tilting the tv. Since my tv is at the smaller and lighter end of this mounts range, and I dont tilt the tv, the brackets seem unnecessarily thick, and I may try to find ones that will reduce the profile even more.The only negative I have about this mount is that there is no easy way to adjust the level after it has been installed. I've read about other mounts that allow for a bit of post-install wiggle, and that seems like it would be a very good thing to have as an option. Once this one is mounted it is set for life, so make sure to measure and check level twice before drilling any holes.

Reviews.Title: Good quality
Reviews.Author: K. Kral
Reviews.Content: A relative had ordered one of these for a smaller TV, and they recommended it.  My TV is a 50" so I was hesitant.  The price was so ridiculously low, so I took a chance on it.  I decided if it wasn't a strong quality piece I would just send it back.  It is a strong and sturdy mount and very easy to install.  I installed it myself with minimal help from my husband (he is ill). If you are looking for a basic tilt mount that does the job, this does just that in addition to being a terrific price.

Reviews.Title: Best prie for the product.
Reviews.Author: Lee Braddock
Reviews.Content: After shopping around at local stores, I was determined not to be robbed on some simple bent sheet metal that would hang up my new TV. This mount was the most diverse for mounting just about any configuration and was a breeze to install. I was a little disappointed in the built in level which was glued in crooked but it did come with an additional small magnetic hand level which worked great. I would have preferred that the center point on the bottom bracket, where the level was mounted, would have been pre-drilled instead of having the level there. Where I mounted my TV, the stud was directly in the center and I had to drill a hole just below the level. Not a big issue for me but it might have been for some.Overall, I am very satisfied with what I received.p.s. It also came with a free 6' HDMI cable which made this an even better value.

Reviews.Title: UPDATE: Great customer Service will make it right
Reviews.Author: Splat Matt
Reviews.Content: UPDATE: They (Cheetah Mounts) contacted me regarding my product and sent me a replacement mount at no expense plus an HDMI cable.  This mount is made much better and no damage whatsoever.  Based on this experience I would recommend Cheetah mounts and would buy another mount from them in the future!Additional note: this unit also came with a more complete hardware packet for a variety of installations._____________________________________________________If you have seen or installed other flat screen monitor wall mounts you will instantly recognize that the APTMM2B is definitely an economy mount.  That does not mean you should avoid this mount or that it is inferior.Boiled down facts:Metal is thin but strongWhen hanging the monitor you need to hang with 2 people regardless of how strong you are to ensure that both sides hook to the upper rail properly.  Another concern is since the metal hooks are made from a thin stamped piece of metal you can bend them easily during install (e.g. hanging one side on the rail while then the other as opposed to two people hanging both sides simultaneously).If your video input panel is located on the back and is not deeply recessed (~1" or more) then it is advisable to install the included spacers so there is enough room for the cables to bend without strain.  To user the M8 20mm spacers you will need to buy longer screws than what is included.  For example, my 42" Samsung PN42B450 (plasma TV so by current standards it is heavy for it size vs. an LCD TV) needed to use the M8 screws  apx. 20mm needs to be able to thread into the TV.  I purchased Qty: 4 M8 40mm screws which after spacers, bracket and washers left me with ~18mm to thread into the TVs thread mounting sockets (head type doesn't really matter it can be hex socket (allen key), torx, hexagon, phillips).  Also without the spacers you will find it very difficult to release and tighten the tilt-lock  mechanism.So how is this different to a more expensive bracket?  Well, not much after it is installed.  On a more expensive wall bracket the metal is heavier (thicker) so when you hang the TV to the rails you feel and hear a confident "clunk" connection with very little play.  Also the tilt mechanism on a more expensive mount is smoother and generally easier to utilize.  However once the APTMM2B is installed and positioned there is no play and the TV feels just as secure as a more expensive mount.  Even while adjusting the tilt while the rails are locked to prevent left or right traveling the APTMM2B mount feels secure.  With that said, I would not feel comfortable installing any TV over 46" for the simple fact that I think the rail hooks could easily bend under a heavier TV if you accidentally tweak them in process of hanging the TV.

Reviews.Title: Poorly manufactured
Reviews.Author: Lane Shields
Reviews.Content: I may have just gotten a dud unit, but the one that was shipped to me was clearly poorly manufactured.  On the wall mount, one of the side pieces would not screw into the top flushly.  Therefore, the whole mount would not sit flush against the wall.  Then, I checked the brackets that screw into the back of the TV.  On one of them, the hooks were so bent that it connected to the wall bracket at about a 20 degree angle.  The other was flush.  The box didn't look damaged in shipment. There were other items in the order that were not damaged.  It just seemed poorly made.  Mine clearly was not functional to hang an expensive TV.  But I'd be wary about other units from this manufacturer, too, since mine was so badly made.

Reviews.Title: Piece of crap
Reviews.Author: Michael Fox
Reviews.Content: Honestly, shame on me for even thinking of hanging my $3000 65" TV on this $25 mount. This mount is terrible quality and screws together like an erector set. I wouldn't hang my jacket on this thing. Does not work with a 65" LED ultra slim TV. Buyer beware. 0 stars.

Reviews.Title: I would strongly not recommend
Reviews.Author: Jeremiah
Reviews.Content: I just wanted to warn the next victim not to order from cheeta mounts, I thought it was such a great price being that it was only $27 and everything , well let me tell you that it took two days being that I am a prime member but when we opened the box the mount was in 1000 different pieces  I looked impossible to put together. Hold on I forgot ,we couldn't put it together because cheeta packed all the wrong parts in the box, so I called customer service and they weren't friendly at all. They didn't want to shipp me the rite pieces until I raised hell. Even so they still made me take a bunch of pics and emails to get them to send me out the rite prices, ...... They tell me they will 2day ship it,, well guess what they ups ground it and it takes a week... We open the box and its the same pieces that we didn't need.....what  a wast of time money,patience, and head ache... Do yourself a favor and order one already putt together and STAY AWAY FROM CHEETA MOUNTS

Reviews.Title: Poor service. Two thumbs down!
Reviews.Author: Jerry
Reviews.Content: Part missing......would not send me the part. Expected me to send entire box back and wait for a replacement. Disappointed....

Reviews.Title: Maximum stud spacing of 27" may not work with 16" studs.
Reviews.Author: Jim Lloyd "jlloydinsf"
Reviews.Content: My wall has studs with standard 16" spacing, but I want the mount at at a very specific left-right location on the wall that turns out to be centered over three studs. I can't use the center stud, and the two outer studs are 32" apart, which is wider than the maximum spacing of 27".I'm surprised the mount was not designed to handle my use case, though perhaps it is my fault that I didn't research this more carefully before ordering.I'm giving this review 1 star only to bring this problem to the attention of future buyers. Except for this problem I ran into, the mount seems fine, and possibly deserving of the high rating that most other reviewers have given it.

Reviews.Title: low profile and low quality
Reviews.Author: kin
Reviews.Content: Pros:This is a very low profile wall mount.  The total distance between the wall and the back of my Samsung 46" LED LCD TV was less than 2 inches.Cons:All weight is supported by the top 2 wall screws.  It did seem sturdy enough for my TV but an overall poor design.  The low profile nature of this mount means that if you are using a low profile TV there is not enough room for normal cords (HDMI especially) to stick out of the back without hitting the wall and making your TV not parallel with the wall.  Once this thing is mounted there is no way to adjust the tilt unless you take the TV down first.  You cannot access the connections in the back of the TV once mounted.  Also the low quality HDMI that came with the mount stopped working after a few hours.IMO: Spend a bit more and go with another company

Reviews.Title: Tilt
Reviews.Author: Daniel Young
Reviews.Content: Hi,As usual, Amazon delivered a product in the timeframe specified and at a fair price.  I used the mount with a 65" Panasonic plasma, a large, heavy tv, and the mount had no problem accommodating the set.  The instructions were OK.  Definitely need 2 people for the installation job, which took about 2.5 hours (with lots of measuring).2 negatives that resulted in the 4 star review.  Very minor 1 first- the HDMI cable that was included was defective (big deal, its a $3 cable).  Second, more troubling- no mater what, we couldn't prevent the tv from "tilting" no matter how much we tightened the adjustment screws..Easy enough to solve with a "chuck" between the wall and tv, but annoying.  There should have been some sort of lock washer included that would prevent tilting.All in all, an excellent value for $26 (as was the panny for $1549, sadly not thru amazon.)

Reviews.Title: Poor quality
Reviews.Author: Miles
Reviews.Content: This item is one of the worst TV mounts I've ever seen.  The bracket is flimsy and the washers included in the package to use on it are too big for it causing the bottom to bend.  No matter how much you tighten the arms, the weight of the TV will pull them out to whatever angle gravity sees fit to keep it at.  I installed this today, took it down immediately and ordered another one from a more reputable company.  I will not be buying from Cheetah Mounts again.

Reviews.Title: Tilt on mount would not stay in place.
Reviews.Author: CG "CG"
Reviews.Content: I bought this to hang a 85 Lbs. 60" LCD flat panel, which this is supposed to handle. While the installation was simple, (although I am not sure why they did not use the same size screws on the top and bottom brackets, which meant that you needed to drill two different size holes), the tilt setting for the bracket would not say at the upright position, no matter how tight I made the screws. I ended up placing a block of wood at the bottom of the TV to set the angle. Another point to note is that the bracket places the TV so close to the wall, the electrical plug, and cables could not come straight out of the wall, I had to put angle connectors on all the connections for the cables and electric plug to fit. I have this up for one week now, and appears to be holding. To bad the tilt does not work, I guess you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: Cheap Mount
Reviews.Author: Michael Einstein
Reviews.Content: I bought this mount in conjunction with my new 55 in Samsung LED. I used my existing mount from Best Buy to mount the new 55 in on my living room and then use this new one for my 46 in samsung in the bedroom. I never use the hardware that comes with these mounts because I use heavy duty wall anchors instead, so my review is just off the mount itself.The mount is very cheap and I am now fearing it will bend off the wall. For start, the bottom hooks (part that hooks on the back of the tv to the mount) does not have hooks, but a "safety screw" that you cant adjust once the tv is on the wall. The quality of the metal is poor and feels very cheap. I spent $60 dollars on a mount from best buy and it is night and day with this one. The screws that set the tilt barely keep the tilt stable and are difficult to adjust when on the wall. All and all, this is just a horrible mount and I am heavily debating on taking the hit and buying a better mount. The price should have been the indicator that this is what I would be getting, but I was optimistic. I am no professional or expert by any means, but this being my third mount, I am extremely disappointed!

Reviews.Title: Inexpensive, Quick and Easy to Install
Reviews.Author: A. J. Minhas "althotos"
Reviews.Content: This is a very simple bracket to install and I had it done in under an hour. The longest time took drilling the holes in the concrete wall that I was mounting it to in our enclosed patio. Otherwise, the TV (37" Vizio) installation itself took about 15 minutes or less to attach to the wall. If I had 2 x 4 studs, it would've taken half an hour or less to install this. The instructions are not as good as they could be, but the installation is simple and I'll list the step by step instructions below:1) Hold the wall mount up against wall with the rails facing you. Use a "real" level instead of the one supplied. Make sure the mount is level when you mark the four holes: 2 on top and 2 on bottom.2) Four lag bolts, 2 large (top) and 2 small (bottom), attach the wall mount to the wall. Pre-drill the holes - big bolt holes on top and small bolt holes on bottom. If drilling in a concrete wall, like me, make sure the holes are large enough for the plastic anchors to fit snugly. Don't use anchors for mounting into studs.3) Mount the plate to the wall with the hanging rails facing you. Tighten the bolts till they are snug - do not over-tighten the bolts.4) Using the hook side up, hang the TV brackets on the wall mount. Back out the retaining screw on the bottom of the hanging bracket so that it will clear the lip of the wall mount's hanging rail.5) Attach the hanging brackets to the back of the TV using the screws supplied (at least 4 sizes available). Be sure the hanging hooks are on the topside of the TV. Retaining screws should be on bottom.6) Hang the TV with the hooks on the bracket to the rails on the wall mount. I was able to hang my 37" by myself. Get help with larger TVs.7) Screw in the retaining screws on the bottom, but do not tighten all the way.8) Slide the TV along the rails to adjust for your personal viewing. Snug up the retaining screws on the bottom of the hanging bracket.I only needed help from my wife to tilt the bracket outward while I adjusted the retaining screws. I adjusted the tilt screws and tilted the TV. My wife thinks the bracket works great. The tilt works very well since I mounted our TV at around 60 inches above the floor and we watch from our futon, which is about 9 feet away.

Reviews.Title: Overrated
Reviews.Author: A. Peter Kastin "Cpartak"
Reviews.Content: First of, I'm shocked that no one else has mentioned that this mount doesn't come assembled.  You have to waste 30-45 minutes trying to figure out how to assemble it before even using.  Very annoying.  Second, it did NOT fit my 55" Samsung LED because the legs were too short.  Again, very annoying.  Do yourself a favor and buy the "VideoSecu Tilt LCD LED TV" mount for $35 (http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B001L6EPCQ/ref=cm_cr_ryp_prd_img_sol_1).  I've bought 2 of those and they worked great on both the 55" Samsung LED and 40" Vizio.

Reviews.Title: JUNK
Reviews.Author: Leda
Reviews.Content: There is not enough room between the wall and the bracket to properly attach both bottom safety screws. Safety and install FAIL.

Reviews.Title: Light weight junk
Reviews.Author: Alex
Reviews.Content: Bought this mount for my brand new 55" LG because the product states it is for 32"-65" televisions. This was early December 2011. Right out of the box I could tell this product was too flimsy.  I installed it but had some doubts. Moved from my apt to a new house last week, (late March 2012) and as soon as I took the tv down I could see the mount was bent from the weight of the tv.  Glad it did not rip out of the wall.  Do yourself a favor and spend more money on a better mount.

Reviews.Title: You get what you pay for
Reviews.Author: Choadmeyer
Reviews.Content: This wall mount was inexpensive and was exactly what I was looking for, especially when I saw the $25 price tag. Hoping this wasn't too good to be true, my bubble burst when I got the mount out of the box. One of the two main support beams was bent (not noticeably), but when I mounted my 52" Samsung, it became very apparent how badly damaged the mount was. I had to re-mount my television 4 times in order to get the TV in a position in which it did not appear to be crooked. Because of the bend, the 2 levels that were included were completely useless and I basically mounted the TV using the guess and check method (which my wall / studs did not appreciate).The bottom line with this mount is you get what you pay for. If you're serious about getting a quality wall mount, DO NOT buy this product.

Reviews.Title: Great product and great price!
Reviews.Author: Waldo "waldo"
Reviews.Content: After reading multiple positive reviews, we decided to go with the Cheetah Mount. We were hesitant because it was so inexpensive. Great news!!!  The mount worked great and was a lot easy to install. We were very impressed with the quality. It's really sturdy and holds our new Sony Bravias without a problem. Unlike other people, our mount was not missing any parts. In fact, we ordered two mounts for our two TVs and both were complete with all parts. I'm super happy with purchase and, I'm really glad that I didn't pay a whole lot more for the same product.

Reviews.Title: Mount not a good fit for a (2005) 32" LCD Samsung TV
Reviews.Author: Uriel
Reviews.Content: I received the TV mount and tried to installed it, but it does not propertly fit the 32" Samsung TV that I have; the two metal supports that go in the back of the TV are too long (I would have to break a plastic piece that comes with the TV in order to have room to install them), the holes for the screws don't match the ones on the TV, and none of the screws supplied with the mount fits the holes on the TV.

Reviews.Title: Minimal TV mount for your LCD/LED TV
Reviews.Author: Steve Frost
Reviews.Content: This is a great, minimal mount for my 46" LED Samsung TV. The mount comes in a very small box and is actually 6 pieces (including brackets) but is quick to assemble. Once assembled, I would recommend smaller screws than what is included and also some good anchors to keep it tight with the wall and so that you can sleep at night.Mount tilts very easily and also keeps the TV very close to the wall by eliminating the bulky depth of other mounts. Definitely recommend this one for the quality and slim fit.

Reviews.Title: Good value, not much room between the wall and back of TV....
Reviews.Author: C. Keebler "Hooyahdiver"
Reviews.Content: I have 2 of these. I'm happy with the mount but there's not enough room behind the TV for wires to come out. In fact, you may even have to get HDMI cables that have 90 degree angles to the connectors.At the bottom of the TV where most of the connectors are, there's literally 1/4" space and there's no way to adjust it. It is what it it. But for $27 instead of $120 I made it work.

Reviews.Title: Great Wall Mount
Reviews.Author: HPA2
Reviews.Content: I've Bought this for my 32" Emerson Lcd HDTV. It looks great in my room i would defiantly recommend it to anyone. I just bought another for my 55" we'll see how that goes, i'm sure i won't be let down

Reviews.Title: You get what you pay for but for 30$ you deserve way more
Reviews.Author: Purchase Reviewer
Reviews.Content: I bough this tv mount to hang a 60 inch tv but when it arrived i was extremely disappointed. It is not a one piece wall mount it has several pieces they want you to assemble with cheap screws whose threads strip if you use any strength while tightening them.

Reviews.Title: Great product! Super customer service!
Reviews.Author: Lauren Burnetta
Reviews.Content: Amazing! The customer service with this company is A+++. I lost the directions for assembling the mount during an apartment move. I called their customer service and they emailed me a new manual immediately! The mount is perfect and holds up my 32 inch flat screen securely.

Reviews.Title: Good for the price but there's a catch with some Vizio TVs
Reviews.Author: jmiers "jmiers"
Reviews.Content: First off, this is a GREAT price for wall mount!  At $30, it just can't be beat.Secondly, I was missing one lock washer and one nut, which was easily replaced with a trip to the local hardware store (#10 nut), but it was still a hassle.Thirdly, my new Vizio set (and maybe other models) has its mount points very close to the middle line of the monitor (like less than 4 inches apart) which makes mounting it a little bit complicated because that is the same location as the reinforcement points for the wall mount.  After a few minutes of wrangling with it, it mounted just fine and is a solid mount for our 40 inch screen.All in all, it's definitely a re-buy!

Reviews.Title: works great, east to install
Reviews.Author: Christopher Casey
Reviews.Content: Received the package on time, and in great condition.  The bracket was east to install and came with simple instructions.  I would recommend this to anyone looking for a TV Wall Mount.

Reviews.Title: Great Product!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This is the first TV wall mount I've ever bought... It came with clear instructions and was really easy to put together. I was finished in 20 minutes at most. I would recommend this product to anyone. Very very reasonably priced and a solid product all around.

Reviews.Title: Some screws missing
Reviews.Author: Vishwas "Vzx"
Reviews.Content: I've had mounts from their competitors before and these are just as good if not better. Setup was easy and really did not take more than 15 minutes.Took away 1 star because they do not include vesa mount screws for newer LED TV sets. My kit came with screws that were really long and the TV was just too think for them to go in completely. I had to go to my local hardware store to get screws of proper length. I wish they could have included spacers or shorter screws for the newer slim LED TV's

Reviews.Title: GREAT!!!
Reviews.Author: Michela
Reviews.Content: Do not hesitate to buy this product!! I love my tv mount, easy instructions and went up on the wall quickly & easily and holds the tv great! Great price too!

Reviews.Title: looks good
Reviews.Author: scott lakin
Reviews.Content: It was easy to put together and I love how secure it is on the wall.  I didnt have to buy anything to install it.  Usually the fasteners are cheap, but these were of good quality.  I would not be afraid to hang anything on the wall with these fastemers.

Reviews.Title: Avoid this piece of junk at all costs
Reviews.Author: James Resiter
Reviews.Content: There are far too many positive reviews that will cover up the score of how terrible this product really is.  As some of the more recent reviews have noted, the 6 piece disassembled frame is not sturdy and is subject to bowing and leveling issues.  The two levels included with the product will be of absolutely no benefit once the weight of the TV is added to the mount.  To make matters worse, they've cut corners on the bolts.  Yes, the implements that affix the flimsy frame to the wall are substandard.  Ratcheting one of the 6mm units in resulted in a nice 'snap'.  It wasn't overtightened, nor was it anywhere near the frame.  Seeing the amazing experience that I had with the Sanus mount I used for another room, going cheap here is not the pro play.  Avoid at all costs and save yourself the headache!

Reviews.Title: poor quality
Reviews.Author: Shut Up
Reviews.Content: as far as wall mounts go, this one was a cheap one. doesn't feel very sturdt and the screws at the bottom of the mount don't even touch the mount, so they don't secure the TV to the wall at all. the TV is holding onto the mount at the top with the hooks (zoom in on the image at the top to see hooks) and I feel like if an earthquake happened, that sucker will pop right off the wall and crash into the floor.the hdmi cable it came with is great, and it does come with a free level, so that's nice too. there are just much better options out there for similar prices that will be much better quality.the "flush" 1.3" profile on this is TOO SLIM... you can't access the cords on the back, so changing out DVD players or gaming systems becomes extremely difficult. also there is nowhere to run the cables through, so they are either loose and blocking the mount from lying flush against the wall at the bottom, or you have to sweep them to one side or the other every time you adjust something on the TV. i should have returned this thing when I was still in my return window!

Reviews.Title: Good product, excellent customer service...
Reviews.Author: scribe
Reviews.Content: This is a good product, which is reasonably priced, feels solid and installs easily. The HDMI cable is a nice bonus as well as being utilitarian, attractive, and well built. However, the most impressive feature of this product is the customer service.  I experienced a minor problem with a screw that stripped out and emailed Cheetah Mounts customer service. I didn't want or expect anything but felt they had a good product that could use some improvement and I offered a couple suggestions. The response was immediate. The following day I received a phone call followed by an email, both apologizing for the inconvenience and telling me they would refund my credit card $10. They did.  Problems happen and stuff breaks, it's what a company does afterwards the speaks loudest. You can't go wrong with Cheetah.

Reviews.Title: Good Value
Reviews.Author: keith ambrose
Reviews.Content: This mount was put on my 60" sharp TV easy install did the job and good price. Came with everything I needed to do the install

Reviews.Title: tv may fall off wall.
Reviews.Author: Justin K. Roth "justin r"
Reviews.Content: There are four sizes of screws that attach the arms to your TV, one of the four fits your TV. The size of screws that attach the arms to the my TV slip through the holes in the bracket arm, meaning my TV will FALL OFF THE WALL. This product should not be sold. There's no 0 star option, otherwise I would give it that.

Reviews.Title: cheap
Reviews.Author: Sam Zaki
Reviews.Content: not worse the money,very poor qualityit did not take much torque before the bolt snapped.I could have replaced the bolts with better new bolts from the hardware store but why? I opted to return the item.

Reviews.Title: GOOD LUCK HANGING IT
Reviews.Author: Kayla Maudal "K.J. Madual"
Reviews.Content: Got the product thinking it was a good value. This is a "To Good To Be True" product. The instructions suck which force you to enter into a relm of trial and error. Unclear instructions, cant get the bottom mounting screws in place as you need to tighten them when TV is hung and needed to rig a device skinny enough to get behind it to screw it in.

Reviews.Title: Hope you have a friend with extra long fingers
Reviews.Author: David Crump
Reviews.Content: ...that's what she said.  This mount is killer, makes an LED look molded into the wall.  It's a pain in the crass to install if you have a ton of cables.  I filled every port on the back of that and she was pleased.  Although it took some work to get there.  Worth it when you put it in the end.

Reviews.Title: Not Recommend for Heavy Plasma TVs
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: The description states the unit can support 165lbs.  I have a 132lb Plasma which is quite heavy.The top and bottom brackets that support the TV are a very thin gauge steel.There are 2 pieces for the top and two pieces for the bottom which are connected with a bracket that hold the 2 two pieces together with cheap (non-grade hardware).The top and bottom are connected with another small bar that holds the top and bottom together with screws that hold the sections via threaded holds in the side bars.Definitely not a sturdy mounting bracket for a 165 lb TV.Would be fine for plasmas or LED TV under 85lbs but definitely not 165 lbs.Comes with cables, level, LED light which are nice but would prefer to have a better mount than all the extra stuff.

Reviews.Title: Wokrs great and is a good deal as well
Reviews.Author: SEAN
Reviews.Content: Please save your money and dont spend 150 bucks on a wall mount. The mount is the same concept as much more expensive ones at Best Buy and other places (I know since I have used them). It costs much less and is very well made.

Reviews.Title: watching it now
Reviews.Author: nancy w
Reviews.Content: The tiny level..all the screws..great ......BUT the directions!  I had to get my brainy neighbor in to translate. I would buy it again and after taking an engineering course I might be able to do it myself.

Reviews.Title: Yup, it's a great mount at a great price.
Reviews.Author: N. Newell
Reviews.Content: Worked great with my Samsung F8500 64" plasma.  No problems or issues whatsoever.  It really keeps the TV snug against the wall which looks a lot better than having a 2-3" gap between the TV and the wall.  I would recommend this mount.

Reviews.Title: Easy & Worsk
Reviews.Author: Matt Overton
Reviews.Content: Easy to install and it works as it should. Screwed directly into wall studs and it works well. Took about an hour to install with a second set of hands. The directions are lacking but you can figure it out.

Reviews.Title: Slim Look and Easy to Install
Reviews.Author: Violetsmine
Reviews.Content: I first contacted my TV manufacturer to find out what sort of things I had to look for in a wall mount.  I found that the Cheetah met the specifications and ordered one.  It arrived quickly, and when I did have it hung a week later it went up smoothly with no problems.  I love the slim look it has with no bulky metal parts showing.  I would recommend this product for anyone who is looking to hang a flat screen on their wall.

Reviews.Title: Great mount
Reviews.Author: Daniel Norville
Reviews.Content: This thing was delivered quickly and was super easy to install. I was able to mount my 50" Samsung plasma which weights at least 50 lbs. Looks great up on the wall now

Reviews.Title: Easy to install and very stable
Reviews.Author: Michael
Reviews.Content: Ok, you have to pay attention to the instructions. Also, they give you more parts than you will end up using. In addition, I did have to go buy longer bolts for my TV to fit. I don't know, maybe I should give it 4 stars, but my TV is on the wall, and I did it myself (someone helped my lift the TV).It's very stable, and I liked that it would accommodate my Panasonic TV (Not all of them do) and the strange spacing of my studs (my house is over 100 years old). All-in-all, great product.

Reviews.Title: great value
Reviews.Author: drummerJ
Reviews.Content: The mount works great and is priced well. Easy to install, easy to level, and the added bonus of a cable is great.

Reviews.Title: Works great! Easy enough setup
Reviews.Author: R3D MessiaH
Reviews.Content: I bought this originally to mount a 46" and just recently I have purchased a 55". Holds both up with no problem. My only source of frustration was the instructions weren't explained in too much depth but I figured it out fairly quickly.Also if you're as impatient as I am I suggest you get yourself a stud-finder as I got irritated with the knocking/magnet method and just started drilling holes every 16". The TV hides all the holes though! Guess I gotta buy some spackle now...

Reviews.Title: Very Slim design
Reviews.Author: Jarod Rishe
Reviews.Content: This mount is very slim, I hung this on a wall where people will be able to see behind the TV everytime they come in the house, and i am very happy with how it looks.  The package came with an HDMI cable, that i wont be using, and a magnetic level that makes hanging the mount level very easy.I did have a small issue with this mount but nothing I was concerned with so I gave the product a 4 out of 5 stars but only a few hours after posting this review the company contacted me, asked what my issue was, and voluntarily offered to send me the replacement parts at no cost to me.  I can honestly say you do not find customer service like this anymore,  I couldn't believe it.  I will recommend this product to anyone and everyone.

Reviews.Title: Great mount, but terrible directions
Reviews.Author: Aaron Smith
Reviews.Content: This thing mounted an older Plasma TV very simply.  The only issue I had was that the instructions were not very well presented.  I am a very handy person and still had to figure a couple things out.  The mount does a great job.  Just knocked one star for bad instructions.

Reviews.Title: this does exactly what it says
Reviews.Author: alban bejko
Reviews.Content: if you complain about this product you either didnt read the infor or your just too dumb to install it

Reviews.Title: Works great!  Good value!
Reviews.Author: Hien Q. Truong
Reviews.Content: I used this mount for a Samsung LED TV.  Mounted in 15 minutes and is solid as a rock.  Definitely better than the more expensive alternatives at the big box stores.  Very thin profile as well.

Reviews.Title: Works Great!
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey A Stanneart
Reviews.Content: We have a 65" Vizio LED TV for our bedroom. I was worried that the weight of the TV was too much for this mount but it was perfect.

Reviews.Title: I bought one, then I bought another
Reviews.Author: Johnny Mac
Reviews.Content: I bought one, installed it, and then bought another to use for a different TV.  I used these on 60" TVs (One LED and one Plasma).  I'm happy with the inclusion of the HDMI cable as well.

Reviews.Title: Just WOW
Reviews.Author: Gerald Norman "Amazon.com Shopoholic"
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my bedroom and I wasn't expecting a lot considering the price of this unit but WOW was I surprised! It assembled and mounted easily. I didn't need any help to do this solo. Even mounting the 46" TV was easy once I had the bracket installed. The included cable (a Twisted Veins 10' Braided High Speed with Ethernet HDMI Cable) is worth the price of the mount itself! With this new cable I now have audio-return back to my surround system when I want it. I would rate this one of the BEST BUYS I've made, ever! Don't spend $75 to $125 at your local store for a similar product. Buy this mount now and save a ton of money.

Reviews.Title: NO NEED TO LOOK FURTHER.
Reviews.Author: Harley Barbie
Reviews.Content: Get your TV mount from here! My item was affordable, exactly what I needed, and also came with EVERYTHING I needed to get my TV on the wall... get it.

Reviews.Title: Rock Solid!
Reviews.Author: Patrick Cruse
Reviews.Content: HIGHLY, HIGHLY, recommend this product! Simple to install and you can't beat the price with a stick. For the price major retailers sell tv mounts for ($150 +) this is a steal! I have this for my 60" smart samsung & 42" samsung plasma, once you install the bracket to the wall studs, you are golden. Just make sure you get the bolts into the studs! FYI bolt sizes are 13mm & 10 mm despite the package saying they are 8mm & 6mm.

Reviews.Title: More than adequate
Reviews.Author: Tim Kastelein
Reviews.Content: Simple to put together - it's literally idiot-proof. As sturdy as whatever wall you are going to attach it to.  Most TV wall brackets are so much overkill.  This is perfect. Lightweight, the right price, with some value-added bonuses.  Even if you're not the most handy person this IS something that you can do.Remove the TV and use it to do chinups.

Reviews.Title: Very good
Reviews.Author: bsn1620
Reviews.Content: Great product. Very sturdy. Easy to install. VERY low profile. I used this for a 48" led and the face of the tv is about 2.75" from the wall. My tv looks like a picture hanging on the wall

Reviews.Title: Simple and easy to use
Reviews.Author: AA "Amazon Addict"
Reviews.Content: This mount comes with all the pieces necessary to attach it to your TV and to the wall. It can be adjusted to fit any size TV as well. It has wood screws and concrete screws but if you have a metallic stud behind the wall, you'll need additional pieces. It even comes with a mini leveler with a magnetic edge so you can adjust the mount with both hands! Beware though that if you use the tilt function, the cables connecting to your TV might get squished against the wall. Not a huge issue but just a FYI if you're worried about damaging cables.

Reviews.Title: TV MOUNT
Reviews.Author: Abby J. Hatfield
Reviews.Content: Strong and easy to mount.  We did have to get a very long screwdriver (about 18 ") to set the screws for safety so the TV can't come off the wall.  design wasn't the greatest for the average installer.

Reviews.Title: Great value, slightly unclear directions
Reviews.Author: John Ranz
Reviews.Content: I got it together fine, but the directions were below Ikea grade. For the price however it can't be beat. Holds up my 55" tv with no problem.

Reviews.Title: Perfect!
Reviews.Author: David
Reviews.Content: After reading several reviews i was skeptical despite the high ratings because the ones that gave it a 1 and 2 star rating were very similar. I received my product very fast,Out of the boxI noticed there was a lot of hardware that accompanied it, but it is understandable because not every TV is going to use the same hardware. Cheetah did a good job adding a variety of screws with their hardware package.  The material that it was made up of felt strong enough. I also received 2 separate levels (which were both a good tool when i was setting it up) and an HDMI cable. So they do give you just about everything you would need to set up your new mount. The only issue i had with the hardware was the size of the mounting screws. They put huge holes in your drywall.Set upTV: 55 Samsung LED TVWeight: Apx. 50lbsI read a bunch of reviews stating that set up was confusing and difficult. things didn't align well...I had very little trouble with the putting it together. It is pretty self explanatory. IT WAS WAAYY EASY! I would recommend buying a stud finder prior to drilling your holes. It makes a big difference when you mount the bracket. If you like the low profile i would also recommend purchasing a right angle HDMI adapter for your TV. you can purchase then here for cheap or from tiger direct for 10 bucks each. This will guarantee that your TV is flush and your cables arent getting smashed in the back.End result.This mount was perfect for the home. I am OCD when it comes to leveling and appearance, and this mount did the job for me. I have no complaints overall. The HDMI cable is a small perk, but price, invisibility, stability, make this product perfect for anyone who wants to "float" their TV.I would buy this product again if i ever needed a mount for a 55 or smaller in the future

Reviews.Title: Complete needed only a few tools only a few minutes to install.
Reviews.Author: Bill
Reviews.Content: It had everything I needed and more for the install. Quality product with easy to follow instructions. HDMI a plus and 2 bubble levels made sure a level install.

Reviews.Title: Perfect mount for a 40" tv
Reviews.Author: Walter K. Lamar
Reviews.Content: My wife was impressed on how a professional  job came out. The instructions where real helpful ,and plenty of useful hardware arrived with the kit.

Reviews.Title: Great wall mount for 55" LG
Reviews.Author: A You "NM"
Reviews.Content: I got this mount around 2 months ago.  I felt the instructions were pretty straight forward and I understood them well.  I believe others mentioned issues with understanding the lack of instructions but I had know issues.  Just read it and comprehend and thats it.  Look at the pictures when assembling the part mounted to the wall.My only issue, and reason for a star deduction, was how close the TV is to the wall.  I knew about this before but didn't realize the issue it would cause.  There is a screw in each arm connected to the TV that help lock the desired angle into place.  Also there are 2 safety screws at the bottom to keep it from coming off the mount.  I've been told this doesn't matter unless you have lots of earthquakes.  Well what do you know....last week we had an earthquake.....in Georgia.  Thankfully the TV had not moved.  Basically to tighten the 4 screws I would need a 16" long phillips head to reach because my hand won't fit behind it.  It also is inconvenient when adjust, unplugging, replugging, etc. wires.The most difficult part was mounting it on my own (didn't have help at the time) and alignment.  One thing to consider is that the mount location on your wall is going to depend where your wall studs are.  Because I had a larger TV I ended up shifting my entertainment items below to make it centered and aligned with the TV itself.  It was only a couple inches.  Not a fault of the mount though.All in all, great mount, easy assembly, sturdy, looks great.

Reviews.Title: Works great for Samsung 7100 series.
Reviews.Author: WyattC
Reviews.Content: Very slim mount for my Samsung 60" 7100 series. It is hanging above my mantle and it has a perfect tilt for viewing. Other similar mounts sell for $80-100 and with this price I figured I would give it a try. I am so happy I did because it works and fits perfectly for my TV.

Reviews.Title: A Solid Mount for the Patient Installer
Reviews.Author: David Magayna "Dave M."
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews, I felt comfortable that this Cheetah mount would work fine for my application and it is working fine. It took me about forty-five minutes to assemble, primarily because I was mounting it high on the wall and working with a step stool, so the up and down added to the time as I exchanged tools (or picked up things that I dropped).Putting the mount together is easy enough, although the assembly instructions varied from the actual screw positions on my mount horizontals. The mount is essentially a rectangle – the multi-piece horizontals and two, rather thin, verticals. It isn’t obvious how the vertical pieces fit the horizontal rails, but as I played with them, they would really only fit one way.  Note: I suspect that in the reviews that had issues with screws not fitting, the people only tried to install the mount verticals one way. Trading the verticals out to the opposite side should allow them to fit. On each vertical end there is a 3/8” tab with a threaded hole for a screw. It is off-center, so if the vertical rail is placed on the wrong side, the fat part of the tab will face the horizontal rail and make the screws impossible to align.My studs are 16” and I found them easily enough with my stud finder. I used a finishing nail to make sure I had the stud centers and drilled the tap holes as deep as my bits would allow. I used my own 24” level rather than the ones supplied with the kit to mark the holes. There are plenty of horizontal slots to attach the mount rails so you can easily center them for your space.I believe a couple people complained about the lag bolts breaking. I would caution as you ratchet them into your studs that you take your time. I had no issues with them, but I did drill good tap holes and slowly ratcheted them into place, not tightening them until I had them all in place. I ended up with a level mount that when my TV was hung, looked perfectly level.Mounting the verticals to the TV required four plastic spacers that came with the TV that fit into the TV mount holes before screwing in the screws. We mounted a Samsung 65” LED TV on the mount flat and we used the supplied lock pins for a straight-up position so I can’t speak to the tilt functionality. We just wanted it to be available if we ever needed it. Hanging our TV was a two-person job. My wife and I managed it with little trouble, even though we were raising the TV so it reached the top mount horizontal, up about five feet, and hooking it on the rack.As far as locking the bottom security screws, yes they are recessed from the bottom of the TV. At Kmart, I found a long Phillips screwdriver (overall length – 11 ¾”, blade – 8”) for $6.00. I also used a headlamp flashlight so I had both my hands free. Before hanging the TV, I made sure the screws were loose and turning freely so I wouldn’t need much torque to tighten them when I was ready. I easily found the screw heads and tightened the screws to secure the TV on the mount. My wife held the TV in place although that really wasn’t necessary, just precautionary. The advertised space is 1.3” from the wall and even with my chubby hands I had no trouble securing the screws. Actually, the only thing that gave me trouble was my glasses hitting the wall. So if you have someone handy, and without glasses, they could probably secure the screws more easily.Excellent mount for the price and I recommend it. Points off for the poor instructions.

Reviews.Title: Works great
Reviews.Author: CJ
Reviews.Content: Worked as it should, mounted my 60" vizio with no problems. Assembly went smooth as did bolting the mount to my wall.

Reviews.Title: Does its job
Reviews.Author: Tim Mastny
Reviews.Content: The directions are borderline nonsense, and the way it sits on the wall nearly prevents screwing in the bottom screws.  But my TV is now on the wall and I have no fear of it falling, so there's only so much I can complain.Edit: Their customer service department is quality, and that means something.  They definitely value your business and want you to have a positive experience dealing with them.

Reviews.Title: cheap, but a bit flimsy
Reviews.Author: Chris L "Chris"
Reviews.Content: I didn't realize when I bought this that the wall mount is actually made of SIX separate pieces that need to be screwed together.  It works well - kind of.  One of the holes on a side piece wasn't quite right, so mine couldn't be fastened as tightly as intended.  Wall mounts made of a single piece of metal seem more solid to me.  The two levels that came with the kit are toy-like and a little off compared to my Craftsman level.  I went with the Craftsman and it worked out well.  The hdmi cable seems to be good quality.

Reviews.Title: There is a reason it's #1
Reviews.Author: Taylor
Reviews.Content: This was the #1 best selling mount on Amazon when I bought it for good reason.  The price is great.  For a wall mount with a tilt you would spend more than twice as much at Best Buy.  The product is also great quality.It came in a smaller box than I expected and required a little more assembly that I expected but it was pretty quick and easy.  (I thought the base plate was one piece but it is several pieces you screw together).I was able to install it fairly quickly and felt like it was very secure.  I used my awesome Franklin Sensors ProSensor 710 that I also bought on Amazon to find the studs.  I easily drilled into both studs on the first try.  They include a level but I used my 2 foot level instead.  4 screws in the studs and I had the base plate mounted.  I put the brackets on the back of the TV and it was up.I took a little time to adjust how I wanted the tilt and how it was centered left to right.  I ended up with no tilt at all.  I found it easy to take the TV down to adjust the tilt and make sure everything was tight.  I think the most difficult part was tightening the screws on the bottom that keep the TV from coming off after everything was set and ready.  I had to use a longer screwdriver because of how close the TV was to the wall.I've had the TV up on this mount for a few months now and I am very happy with it.  I have not used the included HDMI cable so I can't comment on the quality but it does look like a quality cable.Next time I need to mount a TV, I'll be buying this same mount.

Reviews.Title: Used it for our 55" TV
Reviews.Author: Ashley
Reviews.Content: My husband put this together for me in about an hour, hung the TV, and we haven't had a single issue. The setup was easy, and our new TV looks gorgeous hanging high on the wall.

Reviews.Title: Not bad for the money
Reviews.Author: techbuyer
Reviews.Content: This is my first TV Wall Mount Bracket I have ever brought to hang TV on my wall.  It's not too bad for the money.  I like the extra HDMI cable and the bubble level included.

Reviews.Title: Works Perfectly - No Reason to Pay More!
Reviews.Author: A. Taylor "Music Addict & Tech Junkie"
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a basic universal flatscreen TV wall mount, look no further. This one installed easily, worked with my flatscreen TV perfectly, and is very low profile so your TV hangs nice and close to the wall (as close as the wires and connectors on the back will let it.) Superb quality. Absolutely no reason to buy similar mounts that are five times the price. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: Best price and easy to install!
Reviews.Author: Richard Martinez
Reviews.Content: I checked several other places and you had the absolute lowest price. They work great with our new TV and were easy to install!

Reviews.Title: Really flimsy
Reviews.Author: Patrick G
Reviews.Content: I had purchased much sturdier racks from amazon in the past and was really dissapointed when this arrived.  Do not use the level.  It is not accurate.

Reviews.Title: NEW DESIGN IS A POOR DESIGN
Reviews.Author: Gerald Beckham "Team Beckham"
Reviews.Content: This was my third Cheetah mount and I'm sad to say that the third time was NOT a charm. The instructions are vague and the drawings aren't clear as to which way pieces are to be placed together to be connected. Thankfully, my dad passed on his engineering brain to me and I got that part figured out myself. BUT when I went to screw in the side bars, the screws were either slightly too large or just made poorly. They would not screw in all the way to create a tight/flush connection with the top and bottom bars. I am VERY glad I did not drill the holes for the lag bolts before figuring out that it would be almost impossible to get a level mount with this thing.Apparently Cheetah had a different design a few years ago and that one was awesome. Sadly not the case now. So disappointed that a company I recommended frequently has let me down. I even had a friend just order this exact mount because of my recommendation. Thankfully, I was able to prepare him for the disappointment he's going to deal with when he gets it. He said he'll just return it before he even bothers opening the box.

Reviews.Title: Hmmm.... Not so hot on a 200 x 200 mount - look elsewhere for this bolt pattern spacing
Reviews.Author: SB_Fluor
Reviews.Content: I used this mount for a 200mm x 200mm horizontal bolt spacing on a 32-inch HDTV - and it stinks.  This is a poor design for this 200mm spacing pattern as it is. Let me explain.Here's the deal.  The horizontal rails on which the TV hangs are actually two smaller rails bolted together end-to-end by a ~6-inch long small steel "patch".  No problem in concept except that the patch bracket essentially doubles the thickness of the rail where it is bolted together.  Keep this in mind as we continue...The TV mounting brackets are U-shaped steel channels with two downward-opening V-shaped hangers on each bracket that are designed to sit nicely on the horizontal bracket.  So far so good, except...The problem with a 200mm mount is that TV mount brackets are about the same distance apart as the double-thick portion of the horizontal rail and if you do not place the TV EXACTLY dead-center on the horizontal rail, one of the TV brackets will be on the double-thickness portion of the rail and the other will be on the single thickness portion, and the bracket cannot hang level.  The inverted V shape of the hangers is allowed to sit further downward on the single-thickness side, and the double-thick portion prevents the inverted V from sitting as low as the single thickness side.  Thus there is no way to simply slide the TV along the rail a bit to center it where you want it without is being incredibly unlevel.  This whole deal is really problematic.After much wailing and gnashing of teeth and finding it impossible to level the TV, I found I needed to unbolt the WALL mount and slide that to center EXACTLY where I needed the TV. I was then able to place the inner of the two downward-opening Vs of each TV bracket on the very ends of the double-thick portion of the horizontal rail. This meant I have the outer of the downward Vs on each bracket hanging in thin air, but as this has safety screws, I figured this was adequate for my 15 pound TV.  But, if I had needed to move the TV even 1/4-inch either way horizontally, I would have the double/single thickness problem for an entire bracket, and I would need to unbolt the WALL mount again and recenter THAT.  This really isn't acceptable...Now, if your TV mounting holes are greater than 200 mm horizontally, your TV mounting brackets will likely fall on outside of this patch area on the horizontal rail, and both brackets will likely sit properly and evenly on the rails.  But remember that horizontal movement along the rail will be limited by the patch and you will have issues with leveling your TV if you move a bracket into the central double-thick zone.As much as the bracket itself stinks for my 200mm mount, the included 10-foot long HDMI cable worked well, the screws/washers/nuts came nicely labeled, the level was level (and handy), and the instructions were clear.So, if you have a 200mm mount TV, look elsewhere - there have to be better mounts than this.  For other, wider TV mount spacings, this should work, but again, there must be better designs that don't have the limitations imposed by this central double-thick splice zone.I would not recommend this mount as currently designed.

Reviews.Title: Cheetah Mounts APTMM2B Flat Screen TV Wall Mount Bracket for 32-65-Inch...
Reviews.Author: StepanK
Reviews.Content: Cheap, but makes job done. Only one minus, it is not adjustable enough to provide rear panel access and tilt down is relatively small.

Reviews.Title: Works for us!
Reviews.Author: SnR41010
Reviews.Content: The only complaint I have is my husband had a difficult time installing our TV on these brackets. Other than that it hold our TV nicely above our fireplace.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Tara Lynch
Reviews.Content: Great purchase! Very easy to install. We will definitely buy this product to mount our next flat screen above our fireplace.

Reviews.Title: Nice mount
Reviews.Author: Ives Lopez
Reviews.Content: All I can say is that I do like it, I got it from amazon warehouse which stated it was "used". The bare reality is that it was not. It was brand new in the original box, all sealed. So I am glad. I mounted my brand new Samsung 50" (not slim) and no complaints about the result.

Reviews.Title: Took a Chance, Totally Worth It
Reviews.Author: Matthew
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a affordable stationary mount for my Sony Bravia 46", which is still on the beefier side of HDTV's and this mount did not disappoint. The instructions were pretty easy to understand from my POV.  I live in a Apt and had to use Drywall Screws but other then that everything went smooth and as expected.  AMAZING quality for the price.  Very Low Profile.  JUST REMEMBER TO PLUG IN YOUR PERIPHERALS BEFORE PLACING THE TV ONTO THE WALL.  Unless you have very small hands.Great Product.  Highly Recommended.

Reviews.Title: Very sturdy mount
Reviews.Author: Frank M.
Reviews.Content: I am using this to hold a 50" LED TV into a plaster wall, the instructions were fairly clear and assembly was also very easy. The included HDMI cable was a nice bonus too, it seems to be sturdy and the 10 foot length is nice for connecting a laptop to watch a video on YouTube.

Reviews.Title: Works we'll
Reviews.Author: Eric S.
Reviews.Content: There are some bad brackets on the market but this one Holds the 42" no problem and I would feel comfortable with up to a 50"

Reviews.Title: OK for the price.  Could be better.
Reviews.Author: Bobula
Reviews.Content: Understandably... this is a cheap rack, so I can't complain too much.  I have used other far more expensive racks, and must say that there is a notable difference.  I won't detail any "pros"... because the rack holds a TV on a wall for < 30$.  that is the pro.The Cons:- for heavier TVs, the rack has difficulties locking in the tilt angle... so it is hard to level- The brackets that hold the TV have a propensity to tilt at different angles.  I've use other racks that when you loosen the lock, both brackets tilt evenly.  Don't know what the other guys do that Cheetah does not, but this rack doesn't tilt evenly.- The screws that come with the package are in metric... so if you have a US drill bit set, you will need to translate.  Unfortunately this results in a bit that is a bit smaller that recommended, and therefore harder to screw in.- The screws that come in the package are hex bolts with no philips or flathead top.  this means you will be hand cranking this into the wall instead of using your power drill. Very annoying. Other providers usually give you proper screws.- This rack expects you to tighten locking screws at the bottom of the rack.  Unfortunately my TV (LG65) doesn't give adequate space to do this.  Doesn't affect stability, but if you have toddlers... the lack of locking bottom can be dangerous (if in kid reach)

Reviews.Title: Really surprising materials quality
Reviews.Author: Peter Spaker
Reviews.Content: OK, I'll be honest. I never heard of the brand "Cheetah" before. I got a flatscreen and knew I didn't want it on some silly stand. I wanted to mount it and run wire and cable in the wall behind it: real slick-like.I never buy an unfamiliar to me, new item until I have compared it to every single other comparable one I can find. I make my own spreadsheets, spend hours in stores with either a phone app or notebook and pencil going a mile a minute. It takes me FOREVER. So again, I have no idea what possessed me to "just buy" this mount five minutes after I bought a TV. But I did.When it came, I didn't start the mounting project immediately. When I finally did open the box, I found pretty heavy duty thick gauge metal that had been black powder coated with heavy duty hinges and a great (included) 15' HDMI cable. Totally unexpected. This thing is TOUGH.Mounting is no big deal once you find a stud.. All hardware is included: also heavy duty. In fact, the materials and hardware are overkill for anything under 46". But what a great product! It can basically handle any TV a normal living room would have, Comes with everything, down to a level!This is a versatile mount that is tough as nails.

Reviews.Title: Crappy design, TV might stay up.
Reviews.Author: J. King
Reviews.Content: The design is very awkward. You mount two hooks into the tv and then secure that to the bracket, but to do that u need a very long 12 inch screwdriver that can squeeze behind the tv. Also if you want to use the tilting feature, you can't actually secure it properly. They must have changed their design recently, this is no way a 5 star design.

Reviews.Title: Easy install, works great
Reviews.Author: Fabian Agudelo
Reviews.Content: I've had my 55" LED for about 7 months on it, and it's sturdy. Screwed right into my tv without problems. Only had to touch it (take it off and on during installation process) about 4 times as I was getting the wiring nicely hidden. Since then, no problems. I was only able to use 2 screws on studs because there was only one stud. But I added additional security with maybe 4-6 big drywall screws/anchors. Better than spending $100 at the electronics store for such a simple bracket.

Reviews.Title: cheetah mounts
Reviews.Author: Peggie Hurst
Reviews.Content: we are very please with our cheetah mount. it really adds to the look of our room to have the tv on the wall above our entertainment shelf. love it!!

Reviews.Title: 3rd kit
Reviews.Author: jhuang
Reviews.Content: this is my 3rd kit purchased.  Love the price.  hate the fact that the metal frame need to be put together first and also the fact that some of the pieces need to be bent a little bit to get a perfect fit.  The level that comes with it is pretty junky, I have never relied on them.  other than that, the mount itself is solid and works fine for 3 of the TVs I mounted using this kit.  (42", 60", 60")

Reviews.Title: Holds my TV on the wall just fine
Reviews.Author: Joseph Kordinak "Joseph K."
Reviews.Content: It is a decent TV mount. Sure it is light weight and skimpy but it doesn't have to be made out of 2 inch angle iron to hold a TV on the wall. My only complaint and I have seen it from other people are that the bolts that mount the brackets on my TV were way too long. fortunately  I had some bolts that would work in my shop. The little level is useless the bigger one is a one time use. I haven't tried the cable to see if it is worth anything. You will need a long screwdriver to tighten the safety screws on the brackets. Mine is holding up a 50 inch Plasma that is around 60 lbs.Update, The Cheetah people actually read these reviews and do their best to make things right. I was totally pleased with my mount but had to use my own mounting bolts because the ones included were way too long. They called me and apologized and went above and beyond to make things right. I was pleased there is still a company that cares what you think of their products. Most companies could care less.

Reviews.Title: Not for a 32" TV
Reviews.Author: soxfamily
Reviews.Content: I've had great experiences with Cheetah Mounts in the past. This one is just poorly advertised. If you are mounting a 32" television the arms that attach to the TV will show above and below the TV. It will work, but they are too long for a 32" TV. I returned for this one and it worked perfectly on a 32"...B0054EKQWE

Reviews.Title: Absolutely a Dandy Value
Reviews.Author: Beth H.
Reviews.Content: In researching wall mount product reviews, I was sufficiently impressed with the Cheetah reviews and price to buy it.  It arrived with extra pieces to insure that the unit would work with a variety of television set-ups - a nice benefit.  The only thing I would say that was not true is how "easy" to install it is.  It probably IS easy for mechanical folks with proper tools and experience.  My sweet husband did not find it that intuitive.  He did figure it out with the instructions, but it took a lot longer than the 15 minutes touted by some.  So, if you are not that handy, prepare for a little more effort.  That said, it did go up and our TV is hanging on it quite handsomely.  It is definitely a steal for that price, as the quality is high and I am pretty persnickety about things that are or feel cheap.

Reviews.Title: Great value
Reviews.Author: Sully
Reviews.Content: I now own two of these, one holding up a 50" Panasonic Plasma and one holding a 40" Sony lcd.  They are simple, sturdy, and very cost effective.  I've installed more expensive mounts from Sanus and they offer no advantage over this mount.  I work in home electronics and my company sells the Sanus mounts but I still recommend this mount to my customers on a budget.Pros:-comes with a level and a pretty nice HDMI cable-large wall mounting bracket helps when you can't center the mount over your wall studs-angle is adjustable and once it's locked in it will hold for good-television is easily removable once it has been hung on the wall-very low profile-consistent quality across the multiple units that I've ordered-ships from AmazonCon-the space between the tv and the wall can be too small.
