I had to put 90 degree adapters on the component connections from my Wii

Reviews.Title: Great TV Mount at Good Price
Reviews.Author: HarryZ
Reviews.Content: After being through sticker shock from Big Best Retailer, I looked on the Amazon site for TV Mounts.  The Very Positive Reviews on the Cheetah Mount convinced me to purchase 2 of them ( 60" Plasma and 37" LCD).  Easy to install and works great. Glad I didn't fall for the Big Best Retailers recommendation.

Reviews.Title: Cheetah mount is a good inexpensive close-to-the-wall option!
Reviews.Author: David Jensen
Reviews.Content: I chose this mount for its low profile and great price, since I only need tilt function and just for a modest HDTV in the exercise room.  It suits the need perfectly.  The only this keeping if from four stars is that, as tilted, the locking screws will not engage to secure the TV to the mount against inadvertent removal...this is because the designer did not account for how much shorter the "tails" of the TV mount brackets effectively are with the tilt mechanism hinged all the way out (as in the product photo, actually).  Since mine is up high on a wall, I am not concerned about this.  However, if it were within reach of children, I would have had to modify it.By the way, those wanting very low profile mounting might also buy 90 degree connectors for HDMI and Cable, as this mount sits the TV so close to the wall that the HDMI and Cable both have to make very sharp turn off the back of the TV.  This is not a fault with the mount, it is a fact of life if you want the TV close to the wall!Cheers!

Reviews.Title: Happy With My Purchase, One Significant Drawback
Reviews.Author: S. Meerdter
Reviews.Content: This is a very good wall mount and I recommend purchasing it. The instructions are clear and to the point. The mount also comes with a variety of standard mounting bolts for your TV should it not come with any (or if you've lost them). The reason I didn't give it 5 stars is circumstantial. I have a 65 inch Samsung 7100 series LED backlit TV that this mount was used for. Once I mounted the television, I find that it is nearly impossible for me to access the "Safety" screws to secure the bottom of the mount (I'm still working on finding a way to get at them). These safety screws are placed to prevent accidental lift off from the top bracket. As the TV is mounted high and I live in Maryland, this isn't too terrible a concern for me. If you live near a fault line and you're mounting a 60" or bigger television, you should consider purchasing a mount with a different design.

Reviews.Title: Cheap, Simple & Solid
Reviews.Author: John Toews
Reviews.Content: 4.5 stars: use your own level!Simple, inexpensive, & correctly mounted, it's totally solid.I'd recommend help boosting the TV up onto the wall bracket.I got everything mounted to the wall and to the TV.  Then I had my wife & adult daughter boost the TV up & on while I stood back and criticized.  Just kidding!  They did a great job.I COULD have done it all solo, one helper would be great and two was deluxe.Didn't time it but I'd guess half an hour.  My mechanical aptitude (MA) is good.  My Dad would have been struggling (MA ≈ 0).An overview to help Dad & his type:1)  The two big long pieces will bolt vertically on the four mounting spots on back of your TV; one on the left two spots and the other on the right two with the 'claws' at the top.Note: There is NO direct connection between these two pieces; they each attach separately to the back of your TV.2)  Once the other 6 pieces are all bolted together, they will mount on the wall.The top and bottom mounting rails each come in two segments that you will bolt snugly together.The two thin strips go (vertically) at each end of the rails to space the rails apart, forming a wide mounting rail rectangular 'frame'.3)  Use a stud finder to locate the studs in your wall (I never use drywall anchors if studs are available).The mounting rail 'frame' is wide enough that you will probably be able to mount on TWO studs....... IF you can only manage ONE stud, it will be near the middle of the 'frame' and, personally, I would use two HEAVY-DUTY** drywall anchors at EACH end of the mounting 'frame'.  **See below.4)  Using your own level, mount the top rail of the 'frame' Dead level on the two studs ... or ... 1 stud and a H.D.** drywall anchor at each end.  Then mount the bottom rail.5)  With a helper, mount the 'claws' of the TV on the top rail.  Be SURE that BOTH 'claws' hook securely BEHIND the lip of the top rail!  You're done!Now, good luck doing it for real!** Heavy-Duty Drywall Anchor:  I've never used this drywall anchor, but it looks great!  Better than the ones I use!  I'm ordering a pack today!  They may be a bit tricky to use on an insulated wall; you have to get the bar to rotate while surrounded by insulation...  Some persistence might be required!TOGGLER SNAPTOGGLE BB Toggle Anchor with Bolts, Zinc-Plated Steel Channel, Made in US, 3/8" to 3-5/8" Grip Range, For 1/4"-20 UNC Fastener Size (Pack of 10)

Reviews.Title: Easy to Install, but get a long philips screwdriver!
Reviews.Author: Eric S. Miguelino
Reviews.Content: Perfect for my 55" TV. Easy to install and level. Very slim profile for a clean looking TV mount.You need a a long philips screwdriver to turn the lock screws for the mount.

Reviews.Title: Can't beat this bracket for the price... Just ONE small problem that is easily fixed
Reviews.Author: Brendo
Reviews.Content: I recently bought this mount for a new 60" Vizio (M601d-A3R), and all in all, I have no real complaints with the mount. After having used other brackets and mounts, this basically has the same features and functionality and the best part is that it is a fraction of the price of many other comparable models. You also have to love the fact that it comes with a solid HDMI cable. You can never have enough of those lying around!My only knock on this mount is that the safety screws (which secure the TV rails to the bottom rail of the wall brack) cannot be reached with a standard screwdriver - I had to order a SUPER LONG screwdriver. So if you have a screen that is larger than 36", you might be in the same boat with the safety screws, if so, just get yourself a TEKTON Extra Long Screwdriver - www.amazon.com/gp/product/B0037GU9UU/?tag=dogknesurinf-20&ie;=UTF8I think the need for the safety screws and the extra long screwdriver could be resolved if they would have designed clips that basically would latch on to the bottom rail. Other wall mounts that I have come with clips and tethers that you can pull that allow them to be released.Pros: - Cheap - Well made - Easy assembly - Easy installationCons: - Reaching the safety screws with a large TV

Reviews.Title: Mounts very close to the wall
Reviews.Author: Dude in Ohio "Who me?"
Reviews.Content: I mounted a 55 inch tv with this bracket. Assembly of the frame is easy enough but you can not get to any of the connections once the tv is mounted. If you want to add another cable you have to take the tv off the wall to do so. Be sure to attach all the cables you need (including your power cable) before you mount it.NOTE: You will need the longest philips head screw driver you can find to reach the bottom set screws.NOTE: The heads of the bolts break easy so make sure not to over torque them.Cheetah makes a different mount that makes reaching your cables much easier. I would recommend the Cheetah Mount ALAMLB Ballhead LCD LED TV Wall Mount Bracket for 23-55" TVs up to 55 LBS with Swivel Articulating Arm. Link: Cheetah ALAMLB Ballhead Articulating Displays

Reviews.Title: Excellent buy / Good quality
Reviews.Author: Changes In Latitude
Reviews.Content: I was very skeptical at first - $25 for a tv wall mount that can hold up to a 65" tv?  Our tv was 50", and this worked perfectly.  Once assembled was very sturdy.  Came with multiple different screws and bolts to fit drywall vs stud installation, as well as universal fit to what I believe must be most if not all tv brands.  Came with two levels (the one shown as well as a string bubble level).  While we used these levels, you may want to use a real, more precise level if you have one.  It seemed to read true, but my experience is these small levels can only be so accurate.  High quality HDMI cable included, which has given us no quality problems running hi def and blu ray to our tv.  Mounting and tv tilt is easy.  Only difficulty is the bottom screms of the vertical bars that attached to the TV.  There are screws that can be used to permanently attach tv to mount, but they are not easily accessible to tighten once the tv is on the wall.  We chose not to secure them since it was sufficient  resting on the mounting rails.

Reviews.Title: This is customer service...satisfaction gauranteeeee
Reviews.Author: Prasant Bai Reddy
Reviews.Content: Good products for a good price. The five star rating is for the customer service provided by Cheetah Mounts. The HDMI cable which was offered with this purchase was defective (Which can happen for cables sometime, i have no problem with that), instead of returning or contacting Amazon I sent an email to Cheetah Mounts stating the problem and the response is :We have processed a shipment with a new replacement HDMI cable. Once item has shipped you will notified by email and provided tracking information. If any further assistance is needed with your order you may contact our customer support at 1-866-602-7742.Thank You,Cheetah Mounts,EF--- Original message ---Cheetah Mounts APTMM2B Flat Screen TV Wall Mount Bracket for 32-65-Inch Plasma LED LCD TVAs part of this order I received an HDMI cable, the cable is faulty and does not work, can you please replace this cable. The wall mount bracket is excellent and works fine.

Reviews.Title: You get what you pay for
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I purchased this wall mount for a 55 inch Samsung. It was fairly easy to hang, there were a few screwups on my end but eventually I got it. To break it down in bullet points:- All of the loose nuts, bolts, washers, etc. come in a bag unlabeled. Be sure to organize the parts before you start.- The included level is nice, but not really necessary. A level is an essential tool everybody should have anyway.- The HDMI cable is cheap of course, but that doesn't matter. A cheap HDMI cable performs just as well as an expensive one. That's the beauty of digital signals. They either work or they don't. There is no in between.My big complaint about this wall mount is that it is extremely low-profile. TOO low-profile, in fact. So low-profile that you can't even use the HDMI cable they give you because your TV will smash it against the wall. You know you don't have very bright engineers when they don't account for a freaking WALL when designing a WALL MOUNT for a TV!But, with a few other product purchases and adjustments this can be worked around.1. Connect all cables to your TV BEFORE hanging it. You will NOT be able to reach behind your TV once it's hung and the safety screws are screwed in.2. Use only 90 degree HDMI cables. This is a must. You cannot use anything but 90-degree connectors because your TV will be less than an inch from the wall.3. If you have a TV in the upper range of this mount's rating (above 42 inches or so), make sure you have some very long-handled screwdrivers and a flashlight available. That is the ONLY way you will be able to fully secure your TV. That and loads and loads of patience.Overall, this mount is functional and can be made to work. The low price gives it points.But, the incredible lack of foresight and poor, barely-functional design makes this mount only deserving of three stars.In closing, make sure you have 90 degree HDMI cables, a long-handle screwdriver (Philips), a flashlight, and patience before attempting to install this.

Reviews.Title: Extremely High Value, Strong, Simple Mount.  A+
Reviews.Author: mike240se
Reviews.Content: Absolutely Superb Mount!I used this to hang a 42inch Plasma.  It was extremely easy to put together and extremely easy to hang.  The hardware is nicely packaged and they even include various bolts needed for various TV's incase the TV didnt come with the vesa mount bolts!  The HDMI cable is a nice value add, its a high quality cable with a strong fabricish jacket.  Nice they threw in 2 bubble levels too.The mount is very adaptable, can fit any mounting pattern and can handle any stud width.  They want you to mount into wood studs though, not into sheetrock!  Don't use the masonary mounts in sheetrock!  Just find your studs and use them, simple.

Reviews.Title: Great Wall Mount!
Reviews.Author: A real customer- Shaun "Howzat goin?"
Reviews.Content: Fantastic mount, helped to get our tv off the chest of drawers in our bedroom.  Now nicely combined with OmniMount Tria 1 B - 1 Shelf Wall Furniture (Black/Dark Glass) for a very nice clean, uncluttered presentation.The fitting is secure and there are lots of screws, bolts etc to help install. Even included is the throw away level.  Make sure you mount into studs, better to do it right and have security that your TV won't fall off than cheat on installation.  If the studs are not standard distances, you can always mount a piece of plywood to wall first, then screw the mounting frame to that.HDMI cable is a little short, but hey, comes with and can use it for the kids TV!I am happy enough with the quality of this product that I will purchase the same Brand but in a different model for my 70" in the living room.

Reviews.Title: only 25 dollars
Reviews.Author: jonathan Breuer
Reviews.Content: This product does everything for only 25 dollars. Do not use their leveler because it is not accurate. I used my 5 foot leveler. Their 10 foot HDMI works perfect.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for the price
Reviews.Author: Jamie Harris
Reviews.Content: Great wall mount for the price.  You do get what you pay for.  But it works great!  No need to spend a lot of money get this one.

Reviews.Title: Existing reviews are misleading because product is different now
Reviews.Author: Brian
Reviews.Content: I bought this mount because of the price and 1000s of positive reviews it's received, but it looks like I should have read more closely to see that the current version of this mount is not the same as the one that got all the good reviews. The horizontal frame bar now comes in two pieces and when I assembled mine, the top pieces would not sit perfectly flush with each other. It was still level across so I went ahead and mounted it on the wall, only to find my TV would not sit level once attached. I remounted the frame, doubled checked it was level on the wall, but my TV still wouldn't sit level. Turns out the frame was slightly bowed, possibly due to the issue I mentioned above. I compensated for this by dremeling the bottom hole on one of the arm brackets to increase it's size, allowing it to shift slightly higher on the TV and make up for the unlevel frame. My TV now sits level, however one side is about a quarter inch farther away from the wall than the other (it's not parallel to the wall). It looks like alignment issue is causing one of the frame pieces to slightly twist, resulting in the difference in distance. This does not give me much faith in the overall strength and quality of the mount.The TV I mounted is a 60" Panasonic Plasma (P60ST50) which weighs 73 pounds - well under the 165 pound rating of this mount. My recommendation would be to avoid this mount and buy one where the horizontal frame bars are a single piece.

Reviews.Title: Happy with the mount.  Holding up my 50 pound TV
Reviews.Author: Jason Kim
Reviews.Content: Pros:1.  The mount and the included hardware is good quality2.  The included HDMI cable is of good quality and is a nice bonus3.  Took less than an hour to install.Cons:1.  It's a bit too flush, and securing the TV once it's attached is a bit of a pain because my hand/arm didn't fit between the TV and the wall.  Had to use a 18 inch screw driver extender on my socket wrench to tighten the anchoring screw.Summary:It's holding up a 50 pound LCD TV without problems.  Comes with all the parts necessary for a quick install.  The included level I gave to my son as a toy and used a 2 foot level instead.  The mount is substantial in weight and feel and I have no worries that it will hold up my TV to the wall.

Reviews.Title: Great mount for the money.
Reviews.Author: Stephen H Bates
Reviews.Content: This mount was easy to install.  It came with everything needed.  Go ahead and throw away the two levels that come with it and use a regular carpenters level.  Also get the 20" long #2 phillips screwdriver that another reviewer recommended to make the tilt adjustment and to thread the bottom lock screws.  Even as two pieces this mount is plenty rigid.

Reviews.Title: Good product. TV fits close to wall on stand.
Reviews.Author: Richard Meyer
Reviews.Content: works great. Didnt relize how close it fits to the wall. Getting the cables in is a tight fit. But for the price, not too bad.

Reviews.Title: love it!
Reviews.Author: deedeeg "deedeeg"
Reviews.Content: Wow. I was a bit intimidated by all of the pieces in the box, but the instructions are clear and it was easily put together. I was able to mount this to the wall by myself and I'm sure it took a bit longer than it should have because I was being super careful to make sure it was level and following the instructions precisely. Once it was on the wall the thing is rock solid. It works exactly the way I hoped and I'm very happy with it. TV looks great on the wall and I can't believe I did it myself. I will be buying three more of these to mount the other TVs in our home. I highly recommend it. It is solidly constructed and the price is great.

Reviews.Title: Easy to Use, Easy to Assemble, works with Samsung UN60F7500, inexpensive & Great.
Reviews.Author: S. Guthrie "Gu3"
Reviews.Content: Fantastic Mount, easy to install, simple to assemble.  Exactly what the seller described, and consistent with most of the reviews I read.  I'm using this with a SAMSUNG UN60F7500 LED LCD.The only issue with this or any other "low profile" (read: very close to wall) mount, is you really need to think about cable routing and the like before hanging the display, or you'll be pulling it on and off again to affix appropriate cables.With that said, I can't imagine paying any more for a mount than I paid for this.  It just does what it says it does.  Worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: Great Product Great Price
Reviews.Author: Kim Torres
Reviews.Content: Easy install...fit great...look good...love it came with HDMI cable and level! Makes my flat screen look nice on my wall..

Reviews.Title: TV mount is well worth the price.
Reviews.Author: . "Mavelman"
Reviews.Content: This was a great price. It holds my heavy 50" Flat Screen TV with no problem. The HMDI cord is really good quality and longer than the one I already had which came in handy. Everything needed was in the box.

Reviews.Title: Good Tv Mount choice!
Reviews.Author: Trinity A. Greer "BakeryArtist"
Reviews.Content: Works great assembled easily. At first the box I had was missing parts, I submit a complaint through their website, one phone later Cheetah sent me what I needed without drama or trouble.

Reviews.Title: Cheap but GREAT product
Reviews.Author: Shontaya Overall
Reviews.Content: Cheap but works great for the past year. It was not as hard as most people said. Read the directions and use common sense which people don't have. Maybe Amazon will sell that soon...maybe in time for Christmas!

Reviews.Title: Excellent value-priced mount with great build quality
Reviews.Author: Davey B. "Gadget Geek"
Reviews.Content: I purchased a Cheetah Articulating Wall Mount Bracket several years ago that was built like a tank, so when it came time to buy a tilt-only mount, I had high expectations for the mount's quality. I am happy to say that Cheetah didn't disappoint; this mount is every bit as nice as my articulating mount from them. Extremely solid, easy to setup, and comes with the hardware to mount just about any flat screen that's on the market.The back plate is bit lighter weight than my articulating mount and comes in two pieces that screw together instead of a single, solid back plate. I would have preferred a single-piece back plate, but in use, it doesn't seem any less sturdy. Since the TV doesn't have to extend or swivel on this mount, I can understand the design decision, and it works well.The included HDMI cable is nice, and the 10' length is handy since you'll often have a wall-mounted TV a little farther away from your entertainment center components. The only thing I didn't like about the items included in this mount kit was the bubble level. I placed it on a flat surface, and it was obvious that the bubble chamber was slightly off-kilter inside the level housing itself. So check your included level first before using it to make sure it reads correctly on each side.All in all, though, I am extremely pleased with this mount. Its sturdy construction and overall quality are well beyond its price point; you won't find anything this nice and for this price at any of the big box stores. Plus, the inclusion of so many types of mounting hardware made installing the TV a hassle-free experience without having worry about ordering additional parts. I highly recommend this for anyone who needs a tilting wall mount. You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: cheetah mounts aptmm2b
Reviews.Author: ROBERT CHARLTON "rjc"
Reviews.Content: used it on my 42" tv worked perfect. tip- make sure you know your vesa size of your tv so you order the right size.I would recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: Great for the money
Reviews.Author: Jennifer
Reviews.Content: As our little one is starting to crawl, we needed to mount our tv.  We saw the reviews for this wall mount and decided to try it out.  The instructions were easy to understand and the parts were labeled via the alphabet.  The assembly went mostly smoothly.  I would caution that the screws/washers included or those that came with your tv may not be compatible.  The screws that came with our tv (37" Vizio) were too small for the brackets of this wall mount.  The screws/washers that came with the wall mount also were too small for its own wall mount.  Too small meaning they were smaller than the opening on the bracket.  We were able to make a trip to the local hardware store and buy bigger washers which worked.  The tv now looks great on our wall.  This wall mount is amazing for the price.

Reviews.Title: surdyproduct
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This is agreat product. good price  it was easy to install snd very sturdy. we had no problems at all.

Reviews.Title: Good mount for Samsung UN55FH6030
Reviews.Author: corporeality
Reviews.Content: This mount was very easy to assemble and fit my 55" television using the largest mounting hole locations.  The mount seems very stable and allows for several inches of horizontal adjustment to get the TV in the perfect position on the wall.  The locking screws towards the bottom were difficult to adjust due to how much the bottom of my TV overlaps the wall plate.  I used a snake screwdriver attachment to reach the two screws from underneath.

Reviews.Title: Tighten the Locking Screws?  Yeah, Right
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey W. Hess "J-Dub"
Reviews.Content: So, look at the picture of this mount.  Now, imagine that there is a screw towards the bottom of each arm, near the lower rail.  Now, put a TV on the arms that extends 10" beyond the lower end of the lowest points on the arms (and at the angle shown is sitting right up against the wall).  Tell me how to get a screwdriver in there to lock each arm to the lower rail.  Yeah, not happening.  They don't make Phillips-head screwdrivers that long.Other than that, this is a simple, inexpensive, no-frills mount.

Reviews.Title: It's ok but be ready to get creative
Reviews.Author: Jesus R.
Reviews.Content: If your t.v uses the bigger size bolts you should be fine.But my Vizio smart t.v. 39 inch. unfortunately needed the smallest size bolts to mount the bracketsand so the bracket space is huge when i tried to use the "star washers" they would just bend and the bold would go through the spacing where the bolt+washer would attach to the t.v. mounts holes.It would have been more effective to just send out normal washers, I'm sure it's not a huge price difference maybe pennies per package?I'm still not 100% sure i want to tilt this mount, If you tilt the wall mount the safety bolts at the bottom of the hooks cannot be used they basically are in contact with the bottom of the wall bracket. Considering the tilt was the reason i bought this mount is somewhat disappointing.

Reviews.Title: Works great!!
Reviews.Author: Jimmie Fan
Reviews.Content: I have now purchased 4 of these. They are the BEST bargain you will find for a sturdy wall mount. All TV's that I use them with are 50" plus! So buy with confidence!!

Reviews.Title: Works perfect
Reviews.Author: KD
Reviews.Content: I've got a 46" Samsung LCD hanging on this and it works perfect.  My TV is 7 years old at this point, so it's pretty heavy, and I have no concerns about the structural integrity of this setup.  Easy to use out of the box, though the level was broken and the HDMI cord is comes with is pretty cheap.  That's not why you're buying this, though.

Reviews.Title: great bracket for a great price
Reviews.Author: nicoray
Reviews.Content: not that hard, anyone with half a brain can mount it, it does what it was intended to do, cant beat the price, i have looked around and this was the best deal out there, very happy

Reviews.Title: Works as planned, more or less
Reviews.Author: Lee Farris
Reviews.Content: I had thought when buying it that I would be able to adjust the angle more easily after mounting - but the screws are very deep so it's definitely not worth adjusting it once it's up. The instructions could also have been much clearer, but I got it done. The HDMI cable was a big bonus, and the mount worked just fine on my 39" LED Samsung.

Reviews.Title: Excellent!
Reviews.Author: D. Nobriga
Reviews.Content: Forget those very expensive mounts this does everything you need.  Are some of the pieces thinner metal, perhaps.  Does it seem to matter at all, no.  This thing secures my 60 as tightly as you could possibly ask for.  Follow the directions and mount it correctly and you will have no issues.  Just as secure as the one I paid 5x more for years ago for another TV in the house.Bonus is you get a cable that does a good job on what its supposed to do.

Reviews.Title: Great Mount, Easy Install
Reviews.Author: T. Footdale
Reviews.Content: Strong mount that comes with plenty of hardware for mounting onto almost every solid surface. Very easy to install and it took me and a friend about 45 mins. It's amazing that the mount has hole patterns for most size/models of TV's. Once mounted it will basically last forever. The only extra tool you might want is a stud finder for a plaster/drywall wall.

Reviews.Title: Works like a charm...
Reviews.Author: RJV "richirichier"
Reviews.Content: It's was perfect for my samsung es7100 55" TV. The only thing one should take care is to plug each n every cable before mounting the tv as there is little to no clearance afterwards. It's not a problem just occasional inconvenience if u have to access back of the tv often. HDMI cable is great too (because of its extra length & rigidity i used it as fishing cable for behind-the-wall cable installation)

Reviews.Title: Awesome mount at an awesome price , tips before you install inside !
Reviews.Author: Jose Abella "InsaneSTi"
Reviews.Content: Before you start this little scary project, scary because if you do it wrong say bye bye thousand bucks !  Rest assured that if done right and mounted on studs, this mount will hold your expensive TV. Before anything else go to Lowes or Home Depot and buy the following 1. A very long philips screwdriver, trust me you need the longest one. 2. 1/4 size washers ( contractor pack ). 3. A reliable stud finder.I mounted a 55 inch Samsung LED TV , the problems I encountered were - the bracket that goes behind the TV did not sit flush, either the screws that came with the mount were too long or I am missing some washers. Regardless I fixed it by putting 3 1/4 washers at the bottom of the bracket and 2 up top, now the bracket is not loose and sits flush on my TV.  My second problem was locking the TV in place , ohhh the drama I went through just to realize that you can not fully tilt it - The solution was dont tilt it ! I honestly thought they gave me a short locking piece , oh well live and learn.

Reviews.Title: Once mounted forget about adjusting the angle
Reviews.Author: B. Deshpande "Flamenco Al"
Reviews.Content: Pros: very compact. somewhat easy(-ish) to install.Cons: not at all adjustable, once you mount your tv to it, only way to change angle is to put the tv down.TV: a 60" LG which weighs 59 lbsThe biggest issue with this device is that once you mount your tv there is hardly any space for your hand to go between the tv and the wall to adjust the angle. There is less than 3" of gap. this cramped space also means that some cabling has to make sharp 90-deg turns. My hdmi cable and cable box cable are both under this stress. dont know how long they can hold out like this. i will have to invest in specialized devices for making these cable turns.

Reviews.Title: Not the best mount
Reviews.Author: Bruce Chang
Reviews.Content: This mount is OK at best. The problem I encountered is that the screws that allow you to tilt the frame are so tight that I couldn't get them to budge. I tried everything to loosen them - borrowed my friend's industrial strength power drill, applying WD40 and other methods. Now my TV is mounted completely straight instead of tilted at an angle like I wanted. Another problem I had were the small screws at the bottom of the vertical bars. Once you mount your TV, you have to tighten these to fully secure your TV. Since there isn't much room between the wall and TV, it's impossible to tighten the screws without an unusually long screwdriver.Warning: If you have a TV like I do where the HDMI port forces your cable to stick straight back then don't get this mount. Since the mount is only 1.3" from the wall, the head of your cable won't fit. I had to cut a small hole in the wall where the head pops out to mount my tv without breaking the port and cable.

Reviews.Title: Cheetah Mounts
Reviews.Author: DeWain Belote
Reviews.Content: Work very well with my new  55" Samsung Smart TV, do not stick out or show on the wall.  Everything blends in like a picture frame.

Reviews.Title: Simple
Reviews.Author: rk pounds
Reviews.Content: LG 55in lcd. I used two 2x4's mounted to studs and then mounted the bracket to bring it out from the wall a little .  The bracket on the tv simply hangs on the wall bracket. I can buy another mount and and hang another tv on the old wall mount without removing any brackets.

Reviews.Title: Hard to put in safety screws
Reviews.Author: Paul MacFarland
Reviews.Content: Got this mount for a 55in LG tv.  The mount was easy to put together and mount to the wall.  The problem I have with it is that is is next to impossible to screw in the safety screws with a standard phillips head screwdriver.  Had to use a snake to get the job done, which was a pain because it required a very long snake.  The mount is very stable though and once it was all put together I was really happy with it.

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: Death Metal Till Death
Reviews.Content: Can't say enough about this mount! I have used it for my 50 inch LED for a few years. Best price I have found and it is solid.

Reviews.Title: Perfect Fit
Reviews.Author: ejl324
Reviews.Content: We bought this for our 50" Panasonic plasma tv.  It is about 5 years old so we were hoping it would fit, and it did!  Installation was pretty easy, it was a bit difficult to mount the tv onto the hook.  Definitely a 2 person job with such a heavy tv.  Other than that it works great!

Reviews.Title: Sturdy Well Built
Reviews.Author: John Q.
Reviews.Content: Mounted a 60" with this mount and it's very sturdy. I mounted my 60" almost a year ago and this mount is still holding strong. I really appreciated the level and hdmi cord that came along with the mount. This was a great buy and I would recommend it to anyone looking for a solid mount. Oh, installation instructions were very easy to read and extra screws and accessories were included for various mounting options. Everything you need to mount your own TV is included in the kit with the exception of a drill and maybe a stud finder if you will need one.

Reviews.Title: Better than described
Reviews.Author: vanessa l. wlodyka
Reviews.Content: Came with every possible screw, bolt, anchor, etc. that we could have possibly needed. Was a little tricky figuring out placement but the included mini level was perfect.

Reviews.Title: Restaurant application
Reviews.Author: Owner
Reviews.Content: Awesome brackets for the price! All you need and nothing more. There is a little assembly but nothing too much

Reviews.Title: Saved Big Money!
Reviews.Author: Cass Mckinney
Reviews.Content: For only $24.00 vs store brands up to $300.00...I was very impressed with this product! Installed very quick and easy for my 52" flatscreen!!

Reviews.Title: very good product
Reviews.Author: Antoni D
Reviews.Content: This product is very good, the only reason why I will not give it full 5is because the screws for the Samsung tv are a lot larger than they have to be for my particular model 6500.

Reviews.Title: Impossible to lock in
Reviews.Author: Joe Matera
Reviews.Content: The mount goes on the wall easily enough, even with the vague directions it comes with. However, the last step of the installation is to tighten the 2 locking screws that go into the bottom rail of the mount. With the TV hooked onto the top rail, these screws prevent you from being able to lift the TV off the mount. Here's the problem...there is no way to reach those screws. They are up behind the TV and once the TV is hooked onto the mount you only have about 1.5 inches of space between the wall and the TV. The second problem is that they are so high up that it's impossible to reach with any standard Philips screwdriver. So you can't see the screws because they are behind the TV, you can't feel for the screws because your hand can't fit behind it, and you can't reach the screws because they are so high up. I ordered a special extra long screwdriver so I could do it. However, I'm now questioning whether I want to go through the hassle. I don't want to have to go through that every time I need to remove the TV from the mount. Remember, all the cables for the TV are generally on the back, so should you need to change cables, you'll need to remove the TV. The unit is great on the wall but that is a major design flaw.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic wall mount
Reviews.Author: Omar Cavazos II
Reviews.Content: For everything this package comes with there is no way to pass up the Cheetah wall mount. It looks great and has a very this profile on your wall. Feels sturdy and was fairly easy to install. Best to have someone help you when installing.

Reviews.Title: its sturdy and great
Reviews.Author: Maria Tanedo
Reviews.Content: we used for sony bravia 32 and its super strong. i love the intruction about finding the studs. thank you.

Reviews.Title: Used it for 60 inch LCD and a heavy 42 inch plasma
Reviews.Author: M&M
Reviews.Content: Wonderful. I bought it for a 42 inch plasma and it worked great. I then ordered another for new 60 inch tv and it worked great as expected.

Reviews.Title: By no means bad
Reviews.Author: Hobbes
Reviews.Content: The part of the mount that is secured to the wall comes in six pieces that you must bolt together with itty bitty nuts and bolts.  It came together easily enough, but the top and bottom rail were not parallel (which technically does not alter performance).  Overall, the TV mount is not nearly as impressive as the larger one I purchased and reviewed several years ago (Samsung Compatible TV mount by Valuemax).  However, there is plenty of strength here to hang my 32 inch LCD TV.My biggest frustration is that my cable outlet and electrical outlet are flush to the wall and positioned directly behind the mounted TV.  And there is not enough room between the mounted TV and the outlets to plug in the cable and power cord.  I think I will be able to solve this problem with right angle connectors. . .

Reviews.Title: Cheetah APTMM2B: Great Wall Mount, Great Price!
Reviews.Author: FHG
Reviews.Content: I purchased this Cheetah Mount APTMM2B flush tilt dual hook wall mount bracket set at the same time I ordered my LG model 47LN5700 47" LED television (which I reviewed earlier) from Amazon. I also purchased the Arlington Industries wall plates to help route the cables into the wall behind the mounted set and then out of the wall behind my credenza. I have yet to install the plates; more about that later.When I ordered the set, the mounting bracket and wall plates, I fully intended to mount the LG set to the wall right away, but didn't. We ended up using the television set on its stand for about a month and finally decided to mount it to the wall. I approached the project as a one man job, eschewing the assistance of my wife, other than to have her show me where to mount the set. To reduce the suspense, I can report that the project went very smoothly, even as a one man job!Let's get started....  First of all, I attached the two vertical metal hook strips to the back of the set using the enclosed Cheetah Phillips screws and recommended spacing washers. I was able to do it while the set was still resting on its stand. In fact, I actually did the 5 minute job while the set was in use. Each bracket matched up exactly to the threaded screw holes on the back of the set. During this phase, I gained an appreciation of the challenge I'd have in routing the cables; see below.The next step was to assemble the four pieces of the wall mount bracket into the rectangular apparatus that is actually fastened to the wall. The bracket is fastened to the wall using the four enclosed lag bolts which are screwed into two adjacent wall studs. Where to position the wall bracket: Looking at the height of set as it was situated on the stand atop our credenza, I had asked my wife how much higher she wanted me to mount the set (vertically) above its current position. She said 10 inches. This meant all I had to do was measure 10 inches up the wall from the TOP CENTER of the set and make a light pencil mark on the wall. Now, I unplugged all the cables, removed the set from the credenza, placed it on its face and removed the stand and then put the set aside until later.It's key to mount the set exactly level and although I have several bubble levels, the bracket kit actually includes two levels, a torpedo level and a small level that clips to the wall bracket. This means I needed only to hold the bracket assembly tightly against the wall, centering on the pencil mark. Then I sighted the level (bubble in the middle of the marks) and drew a pencil line along the length of the top rail of the now-level bracket assembly. Piece of cake. I then found the two studs using my stud finder, marked the appropriate holes to drill, then drilled the four holes (the instructions tell you what size of drill bit to use and how deep to drill). Then I used a socket wrench to crank in the lag bolts, securing the bracket assembly to the wall.The Cheetah folks provide two sizes of lag bolts; the larger two are used to fasten the top rail, the smaller bolts for the bottom rail. Obviously, you will need to drill two different size holes in your wall. BTW, they provide the appropriate anchors if you have masonry walls. The good news is that the 30" long wall bracket assembly is made of stout enough steel so that it won't flex under load even though the bolts into the wall are only 16 inches apart (the distance between the studs). As a result, the TV set (whose brackets' hooks are also 16 inches apart) can actually be moved 13" back and forth along the top rail until you reach the desired horizontal location. Again, the wall bracket doesn't flex one bit; I was very relieved to see this later, because my set had to be at the far right end of the rail in order to center it on the credenza below, exactly where my wife wanted it hung on the wall.Once the wall bracket was mounted, all I had to do was return the set to the top of the credenza, resting it on a couple of bath towels. Then I inserted the six cables into their respective plugs on the set, gathered them together, reached up and hang the set on the top rail. There are a pair of set screws on the bottom of the hook brackets which will be used to further secure the set to the wall bracket once the installation is fully complete, a couple of weeks from now.In conclusion, WE ARE EXTREMELY PLEASED WITH THE EASE OF INSTALLATION AND THE FINAL APPEARANCE OF THE SET UP ON THE WALL. One tremendous benefit of the set being wall mounted is greatly improved audio! The LG, like most really thin flat panel TV sets, has speakers which fire down and back, bouncing sound off the wall. This means the set's sound when on the stand is somewhat "trapped" between the back of the furniture and the wall itself. We always have the "Smart Sound" option turned on, which generates a synthesized surround sound. The set, now being hung on the wall, enables the surround sound to be all it can be; in my opinion, the audio is now 200%-300% better than it was when the TV set was mounted on the stand.FAIR WARNING! Cable management is going to be a challenge since the LG set unfortunately has three distinct locations where cables connect to the back of the set. Believe it or not, the LN Series has HDMI and USB connections actually coming out sideways from near the left edge of the set; others have commented on this in their reviews of the set. Thankfully the power plug comes down from near the center of the set. Unbelievably, the RCA and Optical inputs/outputs point straight back from a site the near the left center of the set. This configuration is the only shortcoming of the LG set. It means that the HDMI cables have to make a 180-degree turn and the RCA and optical cables have to make a 90-degree turn respectively as they exit the set and are gathered together with the power cable which exits downward. I don't think this challenge will be a deal breaker, but it greatly limits the exact location where the top wall plate can be mounted relative to the wall bracket and the set itself.Once the set is mounted, there is just over one inch of space between the wall and the back of the set. The cable bundle (in my case there are six cables) will have to be gathered together, zip-tied and inserted into the small wall plate opening for routing (inside the wall) 30 inches down to a matching wall plate opening behind my credenza where my cable box, Blue-ray DVD player and AV receiver are located. By the way, I plan to cut holes in the wall and install the Arlington Industries cable wall plates and route the cable through the wall at another time, but soon; stay tuned. After I complete that final aspect of the wall-mounting project, including painting the wall a new color, I'll review the wall plates.CONCLUSION...  Finally, check out the price of the Cheetah Mounts wall mount brackets! I challenge you to find anything as good for anywhere near twice the price or more! Buy this Cheetah if you have a 32" to 65" flat panel set to flush mount on the wall; it's simple, it's strong (will hold up to 165 pounds!), it's easy to install, and very inexpensive! As they say when you have a happy wife, you have a happy man; and I'm just that!

Reviews.Title: Excellent value but some issues to note
Reviews.Author: trypsami
Reviews.Content: This is my first review but considering how useful amazon reviews are to me, I felt it was time to contribute one.Pros: amazing price considering the quality and ease of assembly with (most of) the included parts, and closest fit one could imagine to the wall. A previous reviewer commented on the poor assembly and installation instructions (back in 2011). I can report that the instructions are now excellent.Cons: closeness of fit to wall: if your TV has inputs at rear you will need to buy right-angle connectors for the coax and HDMI inputs (and possibly audio outputs, if you are connecting to external amplifier and speakers), unless you extend the mount from the wall. MOST IMPORTANT, if you are using the mount for a TV that requires the smallest (M4) bolts provided with the mount, as I was, you will find that these bolts pass right through the holes in the mount and washers of the appropriate size are not included (as they are for the larger bolts) in the otherwise very comprehensive parts kit. So, a trip to the local hardware store was required. The best washers to use are flat 3/4" diameter with a 1/8" hole used together with the smallest locking washers that are in the kit.

Reviews.Title: not bad
Reviews.Author: Rick R.
Reviews.Content: Not bad for the price.takes a little time to put upI don't like the bottom rail, I would still buy it again

Reviews.Title: Need more spacers if you a Samsung TV
Reviews.Author: Agnieszka Balaj
Reviews.Content: You might need more spacers if you're mounting a Samsung TV. Samsung TVs have a little whole around the screws.

Reviews.Title: good but complicated
Reviews.Author: netta
Reviews.Content: it works NOW after 2wks of trying to get it up, my screws were to short and had to try a few before I got it, directions a little iffy but once up its seems stable , those levelers are $1 store cheep wouldn't stay and the magnet piece tore quickly but it's o.k. for price compared to big box stores xtra cable nice bonus btw make sure if your cables stick out you invest in some of those HDMI Right Angle Adapter Male to Female 90 Degree These point down for me but make sure you check the angle on your TV

Reviews.Title: The best!!!
Reviews.Author: vittal
Reviews.Content: I have used this for 4-5 months now.. easy to install and HDMI cable is a bonus.. I am using it for 32 inch Sony which weighs about 30-35 lb.. very sturdy and nice.. I recently bought another one for 60 inch samsung.. will have to see how it goes..

Reviews.Title: Easy to install the hardware, not easy to manage connection behind it
Reviews.Author: Kals "kals"
Reviews.Content: it is easy to install the mount. But the clearance from TV to wall is 1.5 inches at the top and it is much less at the bottom of the TV, if you are installing it above a fire place and tilting it down.So managing the power, antenna and other connections is very difficult.Also tightening the final set of tightening screws is very tedious as they are not easy reachable because of the less clearance.

Reviews.Title: Product Is Great
Reviews.Author: Dave Cady
Reviews.Content: This product which I have used before is great. Easy to install and is much cheaper than using a $150.00 hanger. Ships fast.

Reviews.Title: awesome!
Reviews.Author: Devon
Reviews.Content: For the price this cannot be beat. I have it hanging on one stud in the center of the bracket with 2 drywall anchors on either side and it is SOLID!

Reviews.Title: Quite possibly the easies way to save your money!
Reviews.Author: Tuan Burah
Reviews.Content: Quit going to your local electronics store and buy this shit son!  It bolts together nice and does the job right. I know people complained about the hardware ... it's freaking hardware! go get some at your home improvement store if the ones that came with it don't work!  Had I had the need to mount it on a concrete wall, the hardware was available ... I mounted it on the wall of my fireplace that's not really a wall (more of a facade) so had to get some toggle bolts.

Reviews.Title: Very good price, good design, but was missing a couple fasteners.
Reviews.Author: Todd Ouchida
Reviews.Content: The price point for this flat screen wall mount is unreal!  Although the instructions are terrible, and I was missing two fasteners, I am happy with the purchase.I found screws, nuts, and washers in my miscellaneous fastener collection (seems everyone has one of these stashes) to replace the missing parts.  The design is very sturdy, but it would have been better if the width of the unit was wider to be able to span at least 3 studs.  That way the studs that are fastened to could be toward the ends of the mount.  The way my TV is located I only had two studs that lined up with the unit, so one of the studs I attached to was at the end, and the other stud is about one foot from the other end.  My 58" Samsung Plasma flat screen seems very secure.  No problem sleeping at night for fear it will crash to the ground.Oh, I forgot to mention, there is very little room between the back of the TV and the wall.  I had to go to a local cable store to buy right angle adapters for all of my connections to avoid my TV angling up toward the ceiling due to the thick connectors.  All of the right angle adapters cost more than the wall mount unit!  But again, it was cheap, I figured it out, it is plenty strong, and it looks great!

Reviews.Title: May want to avoid for larger TVs with narrow profile
Reviews.Author: Trudy Stone
Reviews.Content: OK, to be fair, this was easy to assemble, and I didn't have any of the problems others had with assembly/mounting of the bracket to the wall.  I also didn't really see any problems with the workmanship of the product, or the instructions.  The design is where I see the problem.  With more information about what kind of TV's this might not work for, my issues could have been avoided.  I think for the low end of the range (32" - 65") this bracket might be fine, or maybe one with a little more depth, but I mounted a 50" LG 50PA450C plasma and ran into some issues.  The problems started when I mounted the TV to the wall bracket.  Here's what I encountered:- When I put the TV up on the bracket, without even tilting it down, it put way too much pressure on the cable coming out of the back of the TV, to the point that it was bent to 90 degrees.  This probably was exaggerated by the fact the the cable on this TV comes out of the back at the bottom corner, and being a low profile TV it doesn't allow much clearance in the first place.  Had I known...........- Next problem occurred when I tried to tighten the safety set screws.  With the bottom of the TV less then two inches from the wall, I literally couldn't get my hand behind it to tighten the screws.  I ended up buying a 2 ft. long screwdriver, so that I could tighten it, while I tried to find a better mount for my situation.  The top edge of the wall mount, while I'm sure is strong enough, didn't give me any level of confidence that I could leave the TV on the wall, without setting the safety screws.  Again, maybe not a problem for certain TV's.- For these same reasons, I really had no 'tilt' with this mount.  It was too tight to move.Ultimately, I ended up buying a Level Mount, and found that it was a lot sturdier, and I didn't have any of these problems.

Reviews.Title: Just buy it
Reviews.Author: Meric Gambel
Reviews.Content: Buying similar mounts at local retail stores would cost over $120 at some places-- tremendous markup for something that is out of sight and out of mind. It is products like these that make me love Amazon. Just buy this and be done with it. It works and our TV is now hanging proudly in my den.

Reviews.Title: Not the best, but it does do the job
Reviews.Author: Nesto
Reviews.Content: Last year I purchased a Videosecure mount for my living room tv. This year I saw that Cheetah has the #1 spot so I went with them. Both mounts look similar, but I distinctly remember I did NOT have to put the older mount together like I did the Cheetah mount.Had I known that this comes in 6 pieces for the backplate, I would not have gotten it. Putting the backplate together on your own is doable, but a second set of hands is definitely recommended. (lost 1 star for that)Now once we got the mount put together and the backplate attached to the wall, hanging the TV was a bit of a task. When I had 15 degree tilt, it would not allow the bottom tabs(the ones with the bottom screws) to clear the bottom lip). In fact I had to set the TV to 0 degree tilt in order for them to clear. Luckily this was for my bedroom TV so was not that big of a deal.(lost a second star for this)If you plan on using this mount for a location that will have minimal use, then this would be fine. For a family/living room TV, I would recommend researching a different mount(one that has easier tilt adjustment)

Reviews.Title: Mount was Great But Some Items to Consider Buying
Reviews.Author: Oldylocks Crawdad
Reviews.Content: Used this mount to hang a 47" LG by myself on a Fireplace  The hole pattern allowed me to mount in the mortar joints; So, no permanent damage to the brick.  First time I hung the tv  I had an issue with the HDMI plug not fitting behind the TV.  Added a few spacers between the bracket and the TV and bought a 90' angle HDMI cable.  Problem solved. I also purchased a four to one Remotely controlled HDMI switch that runs off the line power included in the HDMI to reduce the number of cords.  For the  cost this mount worked great.  I will buy another to hang a TV in the living room when I upgrade to a flat-screen.

Reviews.Title: Don't use the level. It's good for a Toy!!
Reviews.Author: JosephN
Reviews.Content: I can't complain much for what I got for $25.  One of the side mount brackets had a misaligned screw hole. With a little force I was able to drive it in on a angle. Cross threading it was the only choice. You may get lucky with yours. The level was so far off, I tossed it and used a real one.  One star off for the screw hole and the struggle to get it to bite. My TV is a 47" very thin 45lb. LED TV. This low profile mount kept it close to the wall.

Reviews.Title: Good enough to add another review
Reviews.Author: NICHOLAS A BIBEAU
Reviews.Content: I was very skeptical of how this very light, very small bracket would hold my 60in 115lb Plasma, but it does the job.Don't expect much (or any) tilt out of this bracket on larger TV's, and you have to be cautious of your connections - The way this bracket achieves support for heavy TV's is by keeping it VERY close to the wall, thus your connectors may get crushed depending on how (and where) your TV accepts those connections and you may want to consider adding 90 degree connector ends.  I used the hidden HDMI on the side of my TV to keep it out of sight and clear from the back.Incredible value for a bracket that does the job.  Looses one star because the level that it comes with is quite chintzy and I wouldn't rely on it - In fact the one I received was inaccurate - but all in all, great value.

Reviews.Title: Incredible product; I wish more companies took pointers from Cheetah!
Reviews.Author: Premadejohn
Reviews.Content: I just installed a TV with this mount yesterday and I could not be happier. I fretted over the TV being too heavy, things not lining up correctly, installation being difficult, etc., etc... But I was pleasantly surprised; this mount is PERFECT.The good:Fairly clear instructions with which are easy to follow along. But I would recommend reading through once before beginning installation.Clearly labeled parts with unique identifiers and sizes... Love this!Extra bolts, spacers, washers, etc. of common sizes in case you don't have what you need. This is awesome, the standard size didn't work for my 46 inch Samsung, but lo and behold, there's the right sized bolt!Solid metal construction (doesn't feel cheap)A small fraction of the price of other mounts, especially when compared to big box storesLow profile against the wallI can't see anything on my wall, except the TVFeels like the TV isn't going anywhere, and it's fairly heavy.Nice, long HDMI cord includedThe kind-of-bad:Because of the low profile, cords with long, hard plastic tips (like HDMI cords), could possibly prevent you from using the tilt if the plugs are at the bottom of the screen. This happened to me, but for all the other benefits, I don't care at all. To fix this, you could possibly cut a hole right behind plugs in your wall... I might do this.Instructions are good, but I'd read through them once first.Overall summary:Simply put, if you want a solid, low profile, non-pivoting mount, get this one. I doubt you'd find a better deal.

Reviews.Title: Design flaw if you need maximum tilt on larger televisions.
Reviews.Author: Adam D. Tonkin
Reviews.Content: My first and hopefully last review, but I thought I should warn others based on my own experience.I bought two of these, one for a 40-inch set and the other a 50.  Overall, it's a great kit, easy to install and adjust. The reason for the 2 stars is that on the 50 inch set there is a flaw that is painfully hard to describe in text, but I'll do my best to explain so others can see if they may run into the issue.The two vertical struts that attach to the television hook to the horizontal struts, via a 'top' hook (on an adjustable 'lever' strut I'll call it) and a bottom hook that is on the vertical strut itself. The top hook rests on the top horizontal strut, and the bottom hook slips underneath the lower strut, and is secured via a screw that you screw that you need to tighten.  It's a very nice, easy to use setup.Based on my room, I needed to adjust the tilt to be the maximum 'down' angle. The problem with this is that the 'lever' strut needed to be extended to the maximum distance (i.e made almost flat) which in effect shortens the distance between the top hook and the bottom hook to the point where you simply cannot get the bottom hook over under the strut.  I had to reduce the tilt back to where the hook on the bottom can get over the horizontal strut... which unfortunately means you can't get the 'most' out of the tilt.It looks as though this would be less of a problem on smaller televisions, because you have some flexibility on where you have to screw the vertical struts on to the TV (which is nice), i.e you'd go higher if you wanted to increase the angle of the tilt, lower if you didn't need it. On larger TVs (my 50 inch is an example) - the screws were at the max top and bottom locations on the vertical struts.Apologies for a such a convoluted post, and if there is a way around this, I will happily change my rating, but I did try a bunch of alternatives - lifting a 50 inch TV up and down repeatedly was no fun!!

Reviews.Title: great wall mount for a flat screen tv...
Reviews.Author: M. Schmidt
Reviews.Content: I purchased two of these for our new tv's. When shopping at wal-mart they charge close to 100.00 for these items. I'm thinking for the little extra effort of putting this together and saving about 75.00 is money well saved. I'd have no problem purchasing these again if I had to replace them.

Reviews.Title: Great product for the price.
Reviews.Author: Steven Kirby
Reviews.Content: The only reason this is not a 5 star for me it because of the safety screw setup on the arms that hold the TV. With my 46'' TV it was near impossible to reach them. For the price you can not beat this mount. My TV weighs almost 100 pounds and this has it secure to the wall.

Reviews.Title: Great Product!!
Reviews.Author: inshon1
Reviews.Content: I used this mount to hang my 60" plasma that weighs well over 100 pounds and this thing is solid as a rock. I opted to use my own anchors instead of the included ones. I highly recommend this mount but if you're going to use this for a larger tv go with larger anchors. I used used a 3/8" Toggler bolt. It's a tad bit larger than the mounting hole so you will have to do some drilling to get them to fit but i promise you that they will hold up much better that the screws that are included.

Reviews.Title: All parts were there, easy to read instructions.
Reviews.Author: John Dorian
Reviews.Content: I read a lot of reviews and comments where people said the instructions were hard to follow. And missing parts. This had me worried.that i would receive a product that would be poorly made. And it took 3 days just to start the shipping process. Figured they were throwing stuff in a box as they went. The box they used was a commercial box it wasn't like they just threw it in a paper bag.My experience was completely opposite. They provide you with more than enough bolts. Every tv is different they cant possibly match every TV in the world. But they sure did their best they offered 3 different sizes of mounting bolts. Everything was neatly labeled in plastic bags by letter, and part name.The instructions were so simple a 3 year old could do it. As with all machined equipment best advice is if something isn't lining up DONT TRY TO FORCE IT. Just think it thru turn it like a puzzle until things line up perfect.That being said, there were a few down sides that i've also seen from other comments. The adjustment of the swivel makes no sense to me. If you adjust it then the locking pin wont line up or the screws wont line up.. something wont line up if you swivel it.Finally the safety pins are a pain in the you know what to screw in if you have a thin tv. It's so close to the wall. And i wouldn't suggest not tightening them as any upward motion to the tv you risk the thing falling down. I had to find a socket that would fit around my screw driver, attach the socket to an extension arm... just to be able to reach the screw.I'd suggest that Cheetah consider making some sort of an extension rod that can be used to help reach them. Even if it's just a solid bar with a Phillips head on the end and a nut on the other that you can attach a socket wrench to and use it to reach the screws.I'm not sure how much this would raise the cost, and i  commend them on how many extra bolts and washers they provide. Those have to add up over time. just to have the extras thrown away.Another note, by the advise of my father who helped me hang the thing, an ex carpenter, we ditched the anchors since we were drilling into studs. Just drilled a pilot hole(tiny hole) and used a ratchet to screw the lag screw in. From doing minimal research on the internet(and i suggest you do the same) anchors are only needed for concrete or if you cant find the stud.Long story short, i  had a pleasant experience. It fit my 60 inch Panasonic and i have no doubt it will hold firm.May ever order a second one for my other TV.

Reviews.Title: Good if you don't have TV connections on the back
Reviews.Author: brian j falkowski
Reviews.Content: It holds the TV fine but if you have rear connections on the tv it is difficult to connect and disconnect cords with only 1.3" to work with.If you have side connections or don't anticipate connecting and disconnecting components it should work fine for you.  I returned it for an articulating model.

Reviews.Title: Cheap and sturdy
Reviews.Author: Casey
Reviews.Content: I installed a 42" LCD TV on my wall with this mount.  I was impressed by how sturdy the frame is and by how easy it was to install on the wall.  After completely mounting the TV, I was not at all concerned by it falling off the wall, just be sure to find at least one stud in the wall to mount this.  If you can't, use the some heavy duty drywall anchors.  You'd hate to lose a $700 because you wanted to save a couple bucks on small anchors.

Reviews.Title: I agree with others who liked it.
Reviews.Author: Mr Engr "RP"
Reviews.Content: This mount is a good value because it is complete including all necessary hardware, a "torpedo" level and an hdmi cable.  It is also a value because it should provide adequate strength for mounting flat screens that don't require a lot of re-orientation from the original mounting position other than tilting it vertically.Make sure you have a Phillips screwdriver long enough to lock the lower retaining screws in place.  I also used two pieces of 2x4 mounted horizontally to provide attachment to the wall studs and provide plenty of thread engagement for the lag screws that mount the frame to the wall (or in my case, the 2x4s).BTW, the mount arrived even sooner than I expected under the free shipping program.  I would have given this product five stars if the instructions were interwoven with the pictures a bit better but this was a minor issue for me and probably for most others.

Reviews.Title: Inexpensive, not cheap
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This was the first TV wall mount I had ever installed, and especially given the earlier reviews I admit I was a little nervous.  It sounded like the instructions would be written in Swahili or something.But it turns out it was pretty straightforward.  I suggest a slightly different order of assembly:  you can put together the rectangular frame first, and affix it to the wall - a studfinder was my best friend right there.  Then, assemble and attach the brackets to the back of the TV.  Then you just hang it like a picture -- the little arms stick out from the back of your TV, and just hook over the frame.  Easy peasy.Only thing I might mention is, you tighten those hanger arms to the desired viewing angle, and THEN put the thing on the wall.  You won't be able to just pull on your TV to change the angle.  Didn't affect me personally, since I only wanted my TV flush against the wall, but I could see how that might be annoying to someone.

Reviews.Title: I have my tv hanging
Reviews.Author: timothy
Reviews.Content: However I can't get behind my tv without taking it off the wall.  If I needed to change a wire or add a wire I would have to do just that.  frustrating

Reviews.Title: BUY WITH CONFIDENCE !
Reviews.Author: Michael Martin "atomichael"
Reviews.Content: Do not waste your money on more expensive mounts unless you need your tv to swivel and move. I am a custom woodworker and make entertainment centers for clients pretty regularly. When it came time to make my own for my 47" Vizio tv I looked around on the Amazon site for a mounting bracket and found this gem. Simple to use. Universal holes that fit any tv's mounting holes. Up to 17degree tilt. And comes with a 10' hdmi cable ! Price just the cable alone and you'll be paying almost what you'd pay for this whole package.

Reviews.Title: Does the Job
Reviews.Author: bmcclure
Reviews.Content: This mount is cheap but well-built for the price. I have full confidence in the mount to hold my 55" plasma TV (which is heavier than the newer, thinner LED TVs). Once the mount was lagged into my studs I hung from it with my full body weight (175lbs).I did not want an articulating mount for this installation because my Plasma TV is already much thicker than newer HD TVs. I wanted a slim profile mount so the TV would hug the wall tightly. This mount fits the bill and has worked nicely thus far (I have had my TV mounted for a couple weeks now).My original product shipment was missing the right upper piece. My package mistakenly had duplicate lower right pieces. I contacted CheetahMount and they did a great job sending a replacement part within a week.I used the included M8 screws to attach the bracket to my TV but I went to a local hardware shop to pick up better lag bolts. I am sure the included hardware is fine, but quality lag bolts are only about $1.50 and I would rather be safe than sorry...My only complaint, and the reason I gave 4 stars instead of 5, is that it is impossible to access the bottom screws once the TV has been mounted to secure the TV onto the mount rails. There is no way I can possible fit my arm behind the TV and screw the screws into place to secure the TV. I am not really concerned and do not think the TV is going anywhere now that it is hanging on the mount but it would offer more peace of mind knowing that those screws are tightened and that the TV cannot budge at all.I have seen others complain about this as well. I am not sure how to solve this problem since it is such a slim mount...

Reviews.Title: Nice mount
Reviews.Author: laurent begue
Reviews.Content: I have a 55' Lg led tv. It worked just fine for me. Everything that you need is included in the box they send you and I find very easy to set up the frame. (i do not understand why some people find that complicated...).I was looking for a thin mount so the tv can be very close to the wall. That mount does exactly that. Be prepared to buy angle adapters for your cables (hdmi, coaxial, optical..) as they might be bent too much and push the tv a little bit from the wall.A great buy for me.

Reviews.Title: Was hesitant at first... still hangin' strong.
Reviews.Author: Abe
Reviews.Content: I was supprised that this required assembly. My first two mounts were sturdy pieces of steel ready to be bolted to the wall, this comes in sections, with directions.Got everything assembled, and hung it on the wall. It supported about 150lbs of weight no problem. So we hung the tv, and it's still there 5 mos. later.The one problem I had, was the screws that secure the mount arms to the bracket. Once the TV is mounted, you're going to need a TEKTON 2773 20-Inch by #2 Phillips Extra Long Screwdriver, or any other extra long screwdriver to get behind the TV and secure the arms to the mount.By the way, the 20" screwdriver is awesome too.

Reviews.Title: It doesnt get any Easier than this
Reviews.Author: Robert
Reviews.Content: took it out of the box, followed Instructions and had my TV up on the wall in less than 1/2 Hr, Its a piece of cake to Install,Highly recommend it

Reviews.Title: ez to do.
Reviews.Author: zack franklin
Reviews.Content: this was so ez and fast to do, loving it. I will get more for every room and I will tell all my friends.

Reviews.Title: great mount, easy to install
Reviews.Author: Cyberkatana
Reviews.Content: I got this mount and installed it without trouble. Very straight forward installation and they even give you just about everything you need. The only trouble i had was that I didn't own a ratchet set. So be prepared if you get this mount that you will need a ratchet set or a crescent wrench would also work i suppose.

Reviews.Title: Good mount but might be too narrow for some TV.
Reviews.Author: Michael D. Case
Reviews.Content: This was the second Cheetah Mount I installed and like the first it was fairly simple to install and the materials and construction were high quality.  The capability to accomodate up to 24" separation between studs was a real plus as well.  One word of caution, though.  The mount lives up to it's advertised narrow depth so be careful about choosing it for your particular TV.  If your cables plug in from the sides and/or bottom you will be able to plug them into your setting without too much difficulty.  But, if your cables plug into your set from the back then you may not have enough room between the wall in the set for the cables to fit.  In that case, go with a mount that has a deeper profile.  My TV has side and bottom mounted cable connectors but I still had to install the cables before I mounted the TV because the space between the wall and my set was still too narrow for my hands.  You also have to make the tilt adjustment before mounting to the wall as there is no room to do so once mounted.One recommendation to the manufacturer:  my set (Samsung 47" LED) requires the M8 screws to attach to the mount.  The screws supplied with the mount were about 3/4" too long and the spacers provided were not deep enough to make up for the extra length.  I had to go to my local hardware store for the proper length screws.  I recommend that shorter mounting screws be included to accomodate for the ultraslim profiles of current LED/LCD TVs.Overall, a good sturdy mount with all the hardware needed to mount just about any set with a VESA 400x400 mount configuration.  Instructions were well laid out and easy to understand.  I would recommend this mount to anyone desiring the ultraslim look.

Reviews.Title: Sturdy and cost effective
Reviews.Author: Srayven "Rayven"
Reviews.Content: Read all the plethora of high reviews for this product, they are accurate. Sturdy and hangs my TV on the wall. Only reason this is a 4/5 star is the directions are written rather horribly. It was not difficult to figure out how it was put together, but the drawings helped very little and the text was only useful for determining what size to pre-drill the holes.

Reviews.Title: Just what I had in mind
Reviews.Author: Mikedaman
Reviews.Content: Great product, assembly of the bracket was not to bad. The security screws are hard to tighten but other wise it's just what I wanted. I mounted my 55" LED LG

Reviews.Title: Cheetah Mounts APTMM2B Flush Tilt Dual Hook (1.3" from wall) Flat Screen TV Wall Mount Bracket for 32-65 inch Plasma, LED, and L
Reviews.Author: Charlie
Reviews.Content: I'm going to give this thing 3 starts because it does work and works good but it is cheaply made, with little quality control since one of my arms was bent a the bottom where it needed to bolt to the back of the tv.Also, if you have an older LCD tv that you are wanting to use this mount on with tilt, then you might be out of luck.  The older LCD's, at least my 46" Samsung, the plugs for your cables plug straight in rather than newer LCD/LED's where they plug in from the side.  The cables stick out on the older ones causing them to hit the wall which will keep it from tilting only so far.  I think you can buy adapters maybe for hdmi, but not sure about component?I'm not sure what the mounting holes on our tv are considered(maybe VESA 700x400 since that says it goes up to) but the brackets that bolt to the back of it had no adjustment left once bolting it up.  My other mounts all have had some extra adjustment to allow me to move the tv up or down more if it needed to be if the mount was not in the right spot.I don't know what the standard mounting height of mounts are but I always go up 54" from the floor and draw a level line and attach the bottom of the wall mount to that that line.  This might not work for you, but for somebody putting one up for the first time, this might help you.  A smaller tv, might need to be a little lower, but you can probably also move the tv down on the mount if you need to.  I just think in my opinion that 54" is a good baseline.All the screws were in the package and I did not use the cable but I am saving it for a rainy day.  The mount will take you a few minutes to put together and you will need a phillips screwdriver and a metric wrench for putting it together.The tilt method on this thing is kind of cheap and you will need a long phillips to adjust it and tighten it if you want to adjust it once it is on the wall.  The mount is just cheap and it is hard to get the tilt the same on both of them since there are no marks to go by and it might not tilt evenly but you can figure that out.  The last complaint I have is the security screws on the underside.  On most of the other mounts I have used, they have a latch or a screw that will hold it in place and keep the tv from even being pulled away from the wall at the bottom of the tv.  The screws on mine, tighten up but do not tighten all the way into the bottom of the mount which will still allow the the tv to be shifted on the mount or you will think the tv will want to pull off at the bottom.  It will not but I just wish the company would have used a longer screw to have it tighten into the bottom of the mount.  It's not going to come off though and the mount does hold the tv.This mount does sit closer to the wall which leaves less space between the tv and the wall so this might keep you from tilting the tv to the desired postition if your cables are in your way.  If this is a problem, try another mount.  Peerless is a very good mount and I have used them in the past but they are a little more than twice the price.Give the mount a try though and if you don't like it, you can always send it back.

Reviews.Title: Very secure
Reviews.Author: C. Donnelson
Reviews.Content: This item came as described. It was easy to mount to the wall and holds my T.V securely. I use it for a Sony 32" in my bedroom. I was a bit concerned because I could not mount the T.V directly in line with my bed. I had to off set it a little and the mount doesn't pivot. I have used it for several months now and both my wife and I are very pleased with this product. I did have to use some 1x2s across the wall and then mount it to that. Just because the gap between the vertical braces was not wide enough for an entertainment outlet to go directly behind it.

Reviews.Title: Quality Product - Great Price, Easy Mount
Reviews.Author: BlinkingRedLight
Reviews.Content: I recently purchased this item to mount a 55" Panasonic ET50 television.First impressions: - Seemed too small to hold the TV and the parts didn't look solid.  First impressions can be deceiving, this turned out to be very solid. - Cable was long and flexible enough to run through everything. - Bolts are labeled well and fit to meet any needs. - Instructions were minimal but simple enough to follow.Assembly: - I put this together myself in about 15 minutes, took more time to find the tools than to put together. - Parts are labeled clearly except for the side brackets. - Arms went onto TV without an issue and had spacers to fill in the extra room.Mounting:- I was able to mount the TV by myself WITH NO HELP.- Magnetic level it comes with is perfect for leveling before the TV goes up.- The mount goes on the wall then you lift the TV onto the mount.I was very pleased with this product and would buy several more if I had other tv's that need to be mounted.  The mount is strong and I probably could have grabbed it and hung on it without it failing.

Reviews.Title: Works Great with my 55" Vizio
Reviews.Author: ALKANIA44
Reviews.Content: I was kinda skeptical about ordering this product for my 55" Vizio smart TV because in the reviews I saw that nobody had used it on this type of TV. But it works great, was easy to put up and looks good hanging on the wall. I would give it 5 stars but the only reason I choose 4 stars was because of the 2 screws at the bottom that you are suppose to tighten up after mounting it is nearly impossible. You can reach the screws unless you have a super long screw driver.  Besides that it was good. Make sure you mount it in the studs. i saw one person leave a review and said it fell off the wall, I'm thinking he tried to use anchors, don't recommend that with this big of a TV.

Reviews.Title: Works Well
Reviews.Author: Michael J
Reviews.Content: It works great, the only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is due to the new product design.  It used to come as one big piece for the wall, but now it required a good amount of time to construct the mount.  Feels nice and sturdy though!

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: Ximebeth
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent cheap wall system, high quality easy to install.Excellent and I recommend to everybody to buy.

Reviews.Title: Don't let the price fool you, this mount works.
Reviews.Author: Kurtis Caldwell
Reviews.Content: I remember when I bought my first HDTV about 6 years ago. I wanted to wall mount it, but at the time wall mounts cost over $200. When i saw the price of this wall mount i was skeptical at first. Then i read the other review and thought i would give it a shot.
